cm-bbmSJU"></div></div><div><div class="cm-RcrQqm cm-AWHrRA sc-ae0f0362-0 kzpuNn" data-cardlayout-edgeless="false"><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/136943343/f4bd70de0ab24742a8b6cae7cddd2423/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=1SindB87IdZDT7kiOnDPUPrdUghDkW-G39m27fJGC3w%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 jrisyt"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div elementtiming="Creator Page V3 : Post tab : First post title" data-is-key-element="true"><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-136943343">New Ambience: Barghest Fell</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-136943343" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span>2 days ago</span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rc4:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rc4:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm back. I had a lovely family trip to the beach. On the way home I dropped both my kids off at college, or uni as some may call it. </p><p>Before I left I had started this track and gotten fairly far into it. While doing my morning walks on the beach, I kept thinking about what the setting might be. I listen to a lot of film and TV scores while I walk. One of these was the score to the Omen by the late, great Jerry Goldsmith. It's a funny thing - walking on a beach in the early morning, waves crashing, sun rising, people walking dogs - and hearing terrifying music as the soundtrack to all of it.  Somebody is probably thinking, "well, that's the power of music, innit?". Ok, yes.  But what it made me realize that as composers and sound designers, we are incredibly free to juxtapose anything, with anything else for effect. I've definitely done this before, but this one allowed me to explore a more complex idea than simply a creepy field with large ghost dogs in it.</p><p>Musically, this starts out almost romantically. There's even a nice melody to let you know things are right with the world. As the piece progresses it becomes increasingly agitated. Ostinato strings and percussion drive things forward. Then it gets strident - gradually increasing in tempo as the action heats up. It goes through a few more changes, including a kind of Elfman-esque  section with glockenspiel and wtf choir.  I think this one can work for a lot of genres, especially the darker side of magic and fantasy.</p><p>Through all of this, we're standing in a field, or fjäll, or fjell - depending on whose culture we're referring to. And then there are the barghests - a new creature for me - which, again depending on the culture, can mean various things. I think a large spirit dog is probably the most familiar, so I went with that one.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive, sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed-version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here, for patrons. I also added a 'rain version' which, well you can guess. And finally, 2 versions that exclude the barghests entirely.</p><p>In other news, thanks to patron Roy for spotting a playlist bug on mobile and pointing it out to me. If you couldn't switch tracks in your playlist on iOS or Android devices, this should now be fixed.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=136943343&amp;m=519261671" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-135876707">New Ambience: Lost Contact</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-135876707" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>August 6</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rcb:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rcb:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Before I tell you about this new track, I wanted to let everyone know that I'm off for the next 10 days for the annual family beach trip (actually leaving this Friday). So, no release next week.</p><p>For this track, 'Lost Contact', I wanted to do a suspense/mystery thing, without venturing into horror. I realized that it's so easy for me to slip down the horror path! This is what I would call a sci-fi adjacent track. Meaning, the original idea was a kind of space station/outpost/abandoned structure vibe, but it could really be anything.  In fact, I went back and forth on whether this should be an interior or exterior location. As you'll see below. I went with both.</p><p>Musically, this is modern style cinematic underscore. Filtered drums, percussive synths, noisy synths and a bit of string ensemble. I think this would work for a fairly wide array of genres. Anything that needs a bit of subtle tension.</p><p>The ambience (interior) is industrial ventilation, equipment shuddering to life, banging doors, reverberant metal and footsteps. The exterior version is a harsh windstorm, various large insects, rustling brush and again, footsteps. It could absolutely be earth based.</p><p>As this track is in sneak-peek mode (until I return from the beach) I've included the mixed-version, as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions of the track. As I mentioned above, I also created an 'Exterior Version' which is the same music with different ambient sound effects. For both the interior (which is the main track, so it's not labelled as such) and exterior tracks I created 'no footsteps' versions for added utility.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support. </p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-135728050" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>August 5</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rci:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rci:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: 5 Aug 3pm EST - pushed another fix and crossfades and playlist loops should respect volume set by slider more consistently now. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Everyone,</p><p>This update is going out to everybody, as all my posts do when they affect the free live site. As many of you know, I've been adding features to the ambience player recently. The latest has been the ability to select smooth fades when pressing stop, as well as the often-requested ability to crossfade smoothly between tracks.</p><p>Today's update has also been on my to-do list for a while. The ability to re-order tracks in playlists. If you open the player up on the site (click the 'show player' button), and add tracks. You'll see that the player expands much more than it did before. Previously, you'd see the top 5 or 6 tracks and then have to scroll for everything else. Now you'll get many more visible tracks before you have to scroll.</p><p>Grabbing the handles on the left will allow you to drag and drop the tracks where you want them. Don't forget to save the playlist after you do! If you want to overwrite the playlist, you must name it the exact same name. You can see what playlists you've got by clicking the 'playlist' button. You can load them or delete them from here.</p><p><em>Tech note:</em> Playlists, like SoundPads and Scenes, are all stored as small text files in your browser's local storage. So, to get them onto another device or save a backup, use the link button to generate a custom link and email it to yourself.</p><p>You can also extend the bottom of the player downwards (to about 60% of your screen height).</p><p>The GIF below explains it better.</p><p><img data-media-id="510839422" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/135728050/b618066899b54a34b9dd3284ad285f95/e30%3D/1.gif?token-hash=fdEeUUhFo3WaUINDxA09AzY9_STh5VFlGG8LJ0ARtmo%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"> <br>I also got a couple of reports of the player not respecting volume adjustments on playlist loops. I believe I've tracked down the issue and that fix is live as well. As with all these updates your browser may need a hard refresh (or 2) before these become accessible.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div class="sc-e9471974-0 eLatQp"><div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/135318244/93c3cb2699294077b24af724ba1c665b/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=PdQo7-DEZnAIKg0raBvId4BVxaGo4YQEhusWxOreJRM%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-135318244">New Ambience: Kingdom of Mist</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-135318244" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>July 30</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rcp:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rcp:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I hope those of you in the northern hemisphere are surviving the heat. New York City has been absolutely sweltering, hopefully we'll get a reprieve soon.  To that point, this ambience may have been a bit of wishful thinking on my part. Although my studio is air conditioned, I still wanted relief from the heat, at least in a sonic way. </p><p>The ambience here is a distant city that exists  within a natural forest/jungle type biome.  I would imagine that it's morning and the famous mists haven't begun to recede (they never do, fully). Above the rooftops and and peaks, large winged creatures soar in wide gyres. Unseen, in the mists below, other creatures call to each other through the dense fog.</p><p>Musically, I began this with a lovely synth pad, and was almost going to leave it all synth based, but then, like pulling a loose thread on an old sweater, I added a single reinforcing string line. Yeah. So then I couldn't just leave it there. The entire synth pad got augmented by orchestral strings. To that, I added a smattering of brass and woodwind. Oh, and choir, because distant cityscapes need choirs. Anyway, the result is kind of a nice intro/exposition piece for discovery scenes or just flying around. Most importantly, it feels cool, unlike the sidewalks outside.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've include the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'No Fauna' versions which remove the large creatures, leaving behind a few birds. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Oh, and in unforced error news - I totally forgot to include the id3 tags in last week's "Prison Block" tracks, so I've re-uploaded those files on that <a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/134780557">post</a>. The audio is exactly the same so if you never use the id3 info or don't care, then you'll never notice. Sorry!</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=135318244&amp;m=508011376" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-134780557">New Ambience: Prison Block</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-134780557" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>July 23</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rd0:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rd0:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Here's a cinematic underscore track that has a moderate amount of pace/momentum. I wanted the energy level to be elevated, but not full-on action. Musically it's fairly typical hybrid orchestration. Synths, and electronic percussion are mixed with ostinato strings, solo cello and some traditional orchestral percussion. There's an ebb and flow to the intensity so it stays out of 'relentless' territory.</p><p>The music definitely leans modern, and I'd say it could absolutely be used in sci-fi and cyberpunk. I'd even stretch that a bit and say it could be used outside those genres as there's nothing high-tech in the ambience that would place it in the future.</p><p>The ambience is a combination of some cavernous room tones, close and distant metallic scrapes, knocks and bangs and and a bunch of distant vocalizations. This could potentially double as a military barracks as well.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 'revolt' versions that amp up the voices into more chaotic shouting that could add a fun twist.</p><p><strong><em>Small Tech Update:</em></strong></p><p>During my CSS updates a few weeks ago, I totally broke the keyword search on a couple of different screen sizes. I only noticed it when I was testing something on an iPad and it didn't work. I believe I tracked down the cause, and it should be working again. Sorry about that! </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=134780557&amp;m=508012797" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-ice-134261745" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>July 16</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rd7:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rd7:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Here's a fun action track for low-key battles and skirmishes. As much as I like big epic battles, not all of them are. In this one you and your party are wandering through a frozen cavern when you're beset by a group of unruly mephits. Obviously, these are of the ice variety.</p><p>Musically, I'd say this could be used for almost anything upbeat. It pushes the pace and keeps things going, but as I mentioned, it's not epic. Pizzicato strings, lots of percussion, choir, and some well timed brass are added to live recorded guitars, autoharp, and djembe.</p><p>The ambience is cold winds, cave resonances and ice falls. The mephits fly about and say nasty things while casting various attacks on you. They're quite unpleasant.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon only sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 'No Mephits' versions for the empty ice-cavern experience, as well as 2 'No Attacks' versions which remove the mephits' spellcasting and vocalizations leaving just the wing noises. This might be useful if you're sneaking up on them! </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=134261745&amp;m=500502041" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/133854380/a1167ccd4a284022b1aea57e056b5e98/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=7DaevvDp2oMMpvMuCFTKaWFBoqTQwlMb79b86yuitsg%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 cNxyiD"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-133854380">Tech Update: Crossfades</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-133854380" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>July 11</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rde:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rde:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm making this a public post as it pertains to all users who access the site.</p><p><em>*May require a hard refresh of the main page to become visible.</em>*</p><p>This all began with  an email from a patron (hey, Eric!) who wanted a more graceful fade-out when stop was pressed on the player. I managed to get that done a few months back, but I knew that the real prize would be to figure out how to do crossfading between tracks. </p><p>I'll spare you the nuts and bolts but this felt like a straight up hack. It involves 2 audio players, one of which is hidden, and passing the playing duties like a baton in relay race. I've been working on this on an off for a few months now and I think I've gotten it to the point where it's solid enough to go live.</p><p>Crossfades, like fade (for stops) are enabled by default, but can be disabled on the player interface (see above image). These choices will be remembered on your device for next time. </p><p>The simplest way to use crossfade is to load a playlist of multiple tracks and hit play. When a track reaches the 9:55 mark, the next track in the list will start to fade in as the current track fades out. You don't have to do anything.</p><p>It also works manually. If a track is playing, and you play another track - a crossfade is initiated and the first track fades out as the second track fades in. When a fade is happening, the 'now playing' text at the top turns yellow to indicate which track is being faded to.</p><p><img data-media-id="497838516" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/133854380/53260e13df36423080e79dbbbf0a643a/eyJ3ZWJwIjowfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=bBF2-eOcJLwnbPkTpQAP11_LE2vHhonBz-VPhkcH9cE%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"></p><p>Now the caveats. Because of the way iOS works, crossfades (or regular fades) won't work on those devices. The site should detect that you're using an iOS device and not even show you the buttons.</p><p>Secondly, Eric and I hammered away at all the edge cases, discovering ways we could trip the system up. 'What if you clear the playlist in the middle of a crossfade?' etc. I've put in as many checks and graceful fails that I could, but honestly, if you mash away at the buttons and interrupt it in the middle of things, it will 'break'. Usually not too terribly but I think I had to reload the page a couple of times. If you discover an annoying, repeatable bug please let me know.</p><p>Additionally, as I was preparing the player interface I decided to do some cleanup/refinement of the CSS (layout) of the main page which makes it work better on varying screen sizes. You may or may not notice it, but portable devices should see a layout improvement with neater and sometimes more visible columns.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div class="sc-e9471974-0 eLatQp"><div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/tabletopaudio/posts?filters%5Btag%5D=tech+update" data-tag="post-tag" target="_blank" class="sc-39651d8c-0 ddnvOs"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rdl:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rdl:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This is essentially a sci-fi action sequence. What action that is, is up to you. The plan was to create a moving, enclosed space where you're shackled to a bench. And now that I think about it, I'd say it was sci-fi adjacent.  It could absolutely be used in a modern story.  I took inspiration from the scene in Rogue One where Jyn is in the back of one of these (the 10 wheeled Star Wars version) and the vehicle is ambushed and she gets rescued. It's a fairly short scene but I though it could work well as a set piece. You could do the escaping yourself, or your comrades could come to your rescue. Either way, you're in a pickle.</p><p>Musically, this is purely orchestral. Nothing hybrid about it. Ostinato strings, brass, woodwinds and percussion. It has several build-ups which help it go from tension to action. I think it has kind of a heist vibe as well and the music only track would work for any number of sneaky, action/chase type scenarios. </p><p>As this track currently in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I created an 'exterior' version which shifts the ambience focus outside. Desert winds, exterior engine and tire/tread noises. There's also a variation on the internal ambience that removes the tech  - which is the walkie-talkie static, console beeps and subtle sci-fi ambient tones. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=133746796&amp;m=496883640" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/133228174/8fa65b24799244a9a7fbb8d38bf54196/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=EWOLHIv4wFE2rApyEC0ff702PsEsdIqNKZB_OxtrFsk%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 OffkA"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-wuxia-133228174">SoundPad: Wuxia (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-wuxia-133228174" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>July 4</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":re3:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":re3:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I have <strong><em>now finished</em></strong> remastering these early edition SoundPads. This is the last one I needed to complete to make the whole set available!</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>I have very clear memories of releasing this original in the summer of 2020. Almost exactly 5 years ago. A surreal experience to be sure, but made even stranger by me deep diving on classic and modern wuxia and kung fu films. In fact, I didn't even know the term wuxia then.</p><p>The idea, like all SoundPads, is to capture an idea, a spirit and describe it in as few choice sound effects as possible. Not to be too overwrought, but it's a bit like the audio equivalent of writing poetry. When a small combination of sounds work, it's very satisfying. There are some really nice background sounds in this one. gently breezes, banners flapping, rain dripping on bamboo.</p><p>The fight sounds were fun. Much like the original Combat SoundPad, I split fights into feet, hands and head (voice). So feet scuffles are added as the base layer and on top of that you could fight with hands, swords or sticks. Fight grunts, yells and special attacks all add flavor.</p><p>The three musical tracks are great for adding the finishing touches. Listening to them years later, I'm still quite pleased how they turned out.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>play the <a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/wuxia_sp.html">Original Wuxia SoundPad</a> online here.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=133228174&amp;m=493664006" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-133124868">New Ambience: The Threshing Hour</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-133124868" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>July 2</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rea:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rea:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: 7/2/25 - Apparently the mixed version got corrupted during the upload so it was giving errors. This track has been replaced and all the downloads are working again. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Cornfields, rusted windmills, distant trains. That's what I wrote in my notebook. I wanted it to feel a bit like an 80s movie, or a retro modern film set back then. So, synths. And then, more synths.</p><p>At some point I thought of a mech. My original concept was a rusting hulk, home to birds and small rodents. But rusting metal hulks don't make much of a sound, so this one needed to be old and decrepit, but barely functional. Maybe caught in a boot loop sequence. Desperately trying to get itself to a power source.</p><p>But the point is we're in the middle of nowhere and now we can tell pretty much any story we want. Kids on bikes discover a body, strange lights in the night sky, restoration of a discarded robot, you see where I'm going.</p><p>Musically, this is about 80% synths - a mix of software and hardware units. On top of that I added my new-to-me autoharp, for some subtle sweeps. An orchestral string section doubles the lead synth line for nice buildup, but it never stops being desolate sounding.</p><p>As this track is currently in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music only, and ambience-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I created two 'no mech' versions which should offer some variation. I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p>P.s. Fixed an issue with Custom SoundPads where the multi-part sounds (x4,x2) weren't working.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=133124868&amp;m=493145433" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/132355842/325035aa49bf44c09d292d71f63ad8df/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=1ufhxr-1qju9h3UZBCbR593WX0ZJhnhoZCxh6cD35vc%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 jWlVUp"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-132355842">Tech Update: SoundPads / Custom SoundPads</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-132355842" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>June 26</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":reh:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":reh:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit 7/2/25 - Oops, messed up multi-part sounds on the Custom SoundPad (x4, x2 etc). This is now fixed. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p><em>This post is set to public as it's for all users of the site:</em></p><p>I've spent a lot of time recently working on the underlying code for the Individual, as well as Custom SoundPads. As I was working on Sanctum (the most recent), I ran into a few maddening bugs, and a few small quality of life issues that I finally decided to address. Here are the main fixes/ new features:</p><h3>Better Looping</h3><p>By far the most frustrating to me was that occasionally a looped file would hitch at the loop point. It was sometimes a tiny little hiccup, other times it was a G A P. These were files that looped seamlessly everywhere. It never seemed to happen on Chrome, but on Firefox and mobile Safari it could be mood-wrecking. Even worse, it didn't happen to every file. I examined the ones that worked and compared the ones that didn't for sample length, sample divisibility by 128 (don't ask), by 256 (ugh, I hated that day), frequency content, anything I could think of. Nothing. I eventually discovered that if I stopped the sound, and played it again - it worked fine. So I created a new playback method that basically silently starts a sound, and then plays it again. It's about a 50ms difference which - is nothing for web audio. Maybe you won't notice this improvement, or maybe you will, but the result is looped audio should now play back much more evenly and consistently.</p><h3>Non Audio-Blocking Modal Dialogs</h3><p>This one was nagging at me for a while. If you're playing SoundPad sounds, and save a scene, or the whole SoundPad (Custom Only), a browser alert window pops up where you can enter the name of the scene etc. The trouble is, and I don't know when this started, this would block the audio stream as long as the dialog was up. Jarring. Worse, sometimes mobile devices had trouble starting it again. So, I rewrote the save bits using modal windows which don't block the audio. As an added benefit, if you use SoundPad wrapped in a streaming service like Kenku, you'll be able to both save, and access your stored SoundPads and scenes.</p><p><img data-media-id="489357454" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/132355842/5940353a134a4ce392775100364b13fe/eyJ3ZWJwIjowfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=-YWivXsZsfql866FqKOt_SvNseeBouO1WqLUyftA1h8%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"></p><h3>Better Cleanup / Stability</h3><p>This one is for Custom SoundPad: I discovered that adding and removing sounds over and over during a session can sometimes make the browser sluggish and slightly unstable. Most people wouldn't notice this, but I tend to hammer on things. This had all the markings of a memory leak, so that's been fixed with proper cleanup and sound removal.</p><p>There were a few other little things here and there but those are the big ones. Nothing to do on your end, just give the pages a good refresh and you should be good to go.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div class="sc-e9471974-0 eLatQp"><div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/tabletopaudio/posts?filters%5Btag%5D=tech+update" data-tag="post-tag" target="_blank" class="sc-39651d8c-0 ddnvOs"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK">tech update</p></a></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-2c79702b-0 gVjFGy"><div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 eOUDRn" data-tag="post-details"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 hUiWRJ"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 vcumg"><div class="cm-CjbveT cm-WLfYlv cm-GENDEJ cm-AMMJHT cm-PkFHzk cm-GGZhvK"><div>Hmmm... A bunch of the sounds have stopped working for me entirely. Sent you a DM about it with more details.</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-6938f163-9 imwKue"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 BsKbD"><div class="sc-6938f163-8 fBebWH"><button type="button">Load more comments</button></div></div><div><div class="sc-622cce91-4 jCAlpp"><div class="sc-622cce91-0 fLpUxG"><div class="sc-d64f4737-0 joDoFb"><div class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/132212313/421a6431f23d4ef0a8df62dcbd0f7b54/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=5fh-U6-FDIWdHXwC24LRo3f463BDHPykseUeWsAsCms%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 OffkA"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-soundpad-132212313">New SoundPad: Sanctum</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-soundpad-132212313" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>June 25</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":reo:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":reo:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p><em>Note: This SoundPad is live on the site (link below), but unlinked in menus. Please share with your friends and family but kindly refrain from posting the link on the internet until after it goes public in a week. Thanks! - Tim</em></p><p>--</p><p>I've had this idea rattling around for almost a year. I've started it at least twice, but each time I couldn't seem to get it right. The goal was an all-in-one religious simulator. It needed the flexibility to do sacred to sacrilege, blessed to blasphemous and ugh, sorry, one more... divine to damned..</p><p><em>Sanctum</em>, the 34th SoundPad, was designed as a toolkit that could work for stories of hallowed ground, or unholy terror. From the chanting of monks in candlelit cathedrals to the sinister whispers of cultists in an underground cave.</p><p>As I always say, SoundPads are puzzles. I'm never quite sure how they're going to go when i start them. It's only by seeing how sounds fit together that a picture starts to develop.</p><p>This one began with the three levels of ambience in the main cathedral. Empty, hushed, and busy. With just those three settings I could already tell there were some stories. here. I added the winds (holy and unholy), the chants, the bells, whispers and footsteps and it was leagues better than my last two attempts.</p><p>Then I wanted to add some locations where stories could happen. I took inspiration from the DM Tools grab-and-go mentality and designed complete one-click looped ambiences to represent various places in, around, and under the cathedral. Don't worry if you've never heard the words <em>baptistery</em>, <em>ossuary</em>, or <em>scriptorium</em>, neither had I , but as soon as I did - I wanted them in there. These are all linked with a handy 'locations' menu item for quick access. (They're also in backgrounds).</p><p>The four 'tones'; organ, bass, timpani, and choir, are designed to be played in any and all combinations. Even when the notes 'rub' a little on the chord changes I think it still sounds cool. All the music/tones on the page were written in the same key so it can be fun layering different combinations. E.g. 'Sanctus Agnus' sounds cool with the organ, bass and timpani.</p><p>The three musical tracks are in a Jerry Goldsmith horror vibe. The first track, 'Benedictus' is basically a cool suspense track. The second one 'Dies Irae' , I debated making it looped as standard -is really a long stinger/riser that's great for intros , reveals or creepy moments. I tried it both ways and it still works. The third track is a straight nod to the Omen films - but in this case , the choir sings 'Sanctus Agnus' (Holy Lamb) over and over again in a rising, falling pattern.</p><p>I'll be adding these to the Custom SoundPad soon.</p><p>(The attached sound files are higher bitrate than the ones on the site - the downloaded SoundPads always are.)</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Here's the<a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/sanctum_sp.html"> super secret link</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=132212313&amp;m=488768766" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 1.152C4.5 5.155 4.5 7.02 4.5 10.5v3c0 3.75 0 5.625.938 6.563C6.375 21 8.25 21 12 21c3.75 0 5.625 0 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>Sanctum SoundPad.zip</a></span></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div class="sc-e9471974-0 eLatQp"><div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/tabletopaudio/posts?filters%5Btag%5D=SoundPad" data-tag="post-tag" target="_blank" class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/131761981/4610470cabb94ff29dc6a2afc6773249/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=IJZSoxw9O22FiSt3n-Dv-Pumd81Vp2nhSUEErP0vENg%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 cIVGfz"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-131761981">New Ambience: Monsoon Temple</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-131761981" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>June 18</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rev:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rev:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>My goal for this piece was to hint (ok, more than hint - let's say obvious nod!)  at Asian religious musical  themes without making it an overwrought trope. And believe me, it was harder than I thought. I'd come back to it and roll my eyes at some of my decisions from the day before. To rectify this, I used almost no traditional Asian instruments.  Instead it's mostly Western and European percussion, chimes, metal percussion, cimbalom, and a deer antler flute from a viking-themed library. In the same way that add the word 'Planet' to many of my SoundPad biomes to unshackle me from realism, this track is equal parts fantasy and even scifi as it is a historical representation. </p><p>The ambience is a temple, open on 3 sides, looking out into a forest. It's raining because it's monsoon season, but the monks of the temple are still going about their routines and chanting and lighting candles and shuffling about. Occasionally a large door is opened and is then closed again.</p><p>The rain is courtesy of an excellent piece of software  that allows me to dial in various parameters for rain and then 'play' them , by morphing between the various conditions using an x-y controller. It's time consuming but it resulted in a constant, subtle movement in the rain that I felt fit the scene well.</p><p>As this track is currently in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here.  Additionally, I created 2 of each 'no rain', 'no chants', and 'no rain, no chants' versions. Hopefully this give a fair amount of flexibility. Without the chants, especially,  I don't think we're bound to any particular theme. </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=131761981&amp;m=485212300" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-131234499">New Ambience: Steampunk Telescope</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-131234499" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>June 11</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rf6:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rf6:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Sorry about the totally on-the-nose title, I began this track as something like 'mystical observatory' but by the time I added in all the telescope sounds and large servos I had a hard time buying the word mystical anymore. But, as you know, I always encourage everyone to ignore my titles and use it how you like. </p><p>My creative brief to myself actually started like this: "A new star appeared in the sky one evening. Things have been strange ever since." I still like that, and I still think it works.</p><p>For the ambience, we have a large domed room, with a massive metal door that opens to the outside. We get combined interior and exterior ambience, as well as some magic sounds coming from whatever the star is. Of course, there's a lot of metallic sounds; levers, ratchets and gears. Bustling about in all the excitement is a person. He mumbles to himself, shuffles to and fro, and occasionally stops to scrawl observations (or lunch ideas) down on parchment by the light of a guttering candle.</p><p>The orchestration for the music is straight orchestral; Strings, brass, woodwinds, percussion and choir. I think it makes for a great discovery/exposition track in that it starts with quiet drama and builds into something a bit more grand and magical. And, certainly wouldn't be out of place in D&amp;D's Eberron setting.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of this track, as well as music-only and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 3 'No Human' versions which remove our mumbling friend and his footsteps and scrawls. I also created 2 'no magic' versions which remove the ethereal emanations sound from the ambience. Finally, I like the intro to this so I created a music-only version of just the intro. This could be good for dropping in to various game moments without having to remember to stop the track.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=131234499&amp;m=481501691" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-130875871">Tech Update: SoundPad Accessibility</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-130875871" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>June 6</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rfd:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rfd:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I got an email last week from a blind user who said he used to be able to access SoundPads using screen reader software, but was now unable to. I didn't think I had changed anything, but then realized that when I removed the way-too-long drop down menu (34 items) of SoundPad links in favor of a single menu page, I had accidentally killed that feature. </p><p>With his help I made some adjustments to the code of the SoundPad launch page and got it working again with screen readers. Other than that, it should be unnoticeable. </p><p>I did some research to see if it might be possible to convert the home page in this way but it quickly became apparent that it is a way more complex beast. </p><p>In other tech news I'm making progress on crossfading tracks on the ambience player. This has been a complex undertaking but I finally saw daylight a few days ago. I'll update you all soon.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div></div><div cm-GGZhvK"><div>Amazing work! It's a very important topic and I'm glad to see it being considered by you :)
If you ever need help with the a11y topic, I'm working as a System Developer with a strong focus on web accessibility for a few years now. Of course the best people to ask for feedback are the ones with actual disabilities but still I would be glad to help or answer some questions :)</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-fa9f7313-2 tMvgA"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 jJSpLr"><button aria-disabled="false" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/130700832/8947df066f664172b6974df7883ddc60/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=upr_aQIWo2XogoFewHIqYkdpqY4_2usBEMPFS3gUee8%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 eANuDP"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-130700832">New Ambience: Battle Stations</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-130700832" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>June 4</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rfk:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rfk:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Phew. This one seemed to take forever. I tinkered with it so much that I was going back and forth between mixing and writing for days. I'd get it to a spot where I liked it, then something would bug me and and I'd come at it from another angle. But! I finished it and I like how it ended up, so here it is.</p><p><em>Battle Stations</em> was an idea I had about a pre-battle montage sequence in a film. This was a scifi/modern style setting so I set it on the hangar deck of a spaceship. It's a chaotic scene where the enemy is planning an attack and the flight crew, mechanics, mech operators, and everything else is in constant motion. That simple command 'battle stations' sets so much stuff in motion. Everyone has something they need to do, and someplace they need to be.</p><p>Musically this needed to have a different vibe. While the activities on the hangar deck seem hurried and frantic, the music should contrast it by being slow and heavy. I wanted it to be dramatic, driving and a bit - I hate this word - epic.</p><p>A simple piano part with a flanger effect on it that makes it sound a bit eastern, pizzicato strings, and a plucked psaltry . Then I went down a rabbit hole of live recording and recorded tracks for electric bass, 3 electric guitars, djembe, and a couple of shakers.</p><p>Then, to punch it all up I added some synths and noise effects. </p><p>Musically this is a fairly modern style, but I don't see any reason that why it couldn't be used outside scifi/modern type stories. </p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I included the mixed-version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'no-mech' versions that remove a lot of the robotic stomps and servos. I also created 2 'No PA' versions which remove the loudspeaker announcements. Finally, I created 2 'No Mech - No PA' versions which remove both. </p><p>I also extracted a few loops that might be useful. A piano loop, a drums/perc loop and a bass/drums/perc loop. I included these in both .ogg and .mp3 format as often .mp3 doesn't do as well with seamless looping in some software.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=130700832&amp;m=477826290" class="cm-pQxmHn
