11.932c0 1.167 1.512 2.334 4.536 4.657 2.393 1.837 3.841 2.945 4.718 3.037.877.093 1.183-.83 1.289-3.051 0-.835.312-1.415.94-1.343 2.18.25 4.592 1.655 5.744 3.924.275.529.636.611.965.611.416 0 .808-.396.808-1.107 0-5.175-2.196-8.895-6.923-9.546a1.653 1.653 0 0 1-1.14-.688"></path></svg></span></button></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div class="sc-622cce91-4 jCAlpp"><div class="sc-622cce91-0 fLpUxG"><div class="sc-d64f4737-0 joDoFb"><div class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/120135006/3d05dbd88a6d4839a1a36b08451f87c7/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=v1eR9HHUr0x1s9XI042h2IVlbms6HwCfuatXRCTJbG8%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" alt="Photo of a sunset" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 ilMSNf"></div><div class="cm-idAfpS"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK cm-RvvWMS">Photo: Ryan Curran White / Parks Conservancy</p></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-feature-120135006">SoundPad Broadcast Feature Sunset</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-feature-120135006" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 29</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rfr:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rfr:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings All!</p><p>I'm making this post public as it pertains to all users of Tabletop Audio -- free, as well as patrons. The main reason I'm writing this is so I can quickly share this post with people who have questions about the feature (which I rarely get these days!)</p><p>Also, I appreciate that you may have suggestions etc but read on and I think you'll get where I'm at!</p><blockquote><p><strong><u>The TL;DR</u></strong>&nbsp;</p><p>I'm sunsetting the broadcast feature for SoundPads for many reasons, but mostly because of server availability and the plethora of other options (Kenku, Voicemeeter Banana etc) that exist now, but didn't when it was launched.</p><p>I will keep it running as long as possible, &nbsp;but it will eventually go offline when the free servers move or shut down.</p></blockquote><p><strong><u>The Long Version - (Only read this if you want the geeky details!):</u></strong></p><p>In January of 2016, I got an email from a German RPG player and computer programmer named Merten. He and his gaming group were fans of SoundPad and wanted to use it remotely, but couldn't. So, he created a software mock-up of SoundPad broadcast for his group using a Firefox browser extension called 'Greasemonkey' which basically allows users to embed content (locally) on a web page in order to extend its functionality. When he asked if I wanted to check it out, I jumped at the chance.</p><p>Broadcasting of SoundPads was always on my radar, and was a feature that had been requested many times. The issue I had was that the I could never seemed to grasp the coding behind web-rtc (real time communications) and there seemed to be a) a dearth of information about it b) highly specific use cases that didn't interest me and finally, c) some seriously unimpressive examples.</p><p>Merten's technique was very clever. He didn't use web-rtc at all. In fact, <strong><em>SoundPad broadcast doesn't even broadcast audio</em>.</strong></p><p>Here's where I get a lot of the technical stuff not-quite-right, so bear with me. Hopefully the gist of it will come through.</p><p>Tabletop Audio Broadcast works by basically by using a text messaging protocol called XMPP. When 2 computers are connected using some basic websockets code (BOSH and Strophe I believe) and have the same SoundPad loaded, the 'broadcaster' plays a button, which sends a tiny text message that is received by the client computer. The software on the client end reads the message and interprets it as 'play x sound'. Unlike real-time voice communication, there is no need for perfect sync.</p><p>At this point, it was working quite well. We want on like this for 3-4 years.</p><p>Issues started to arise when our XMPP host provider decided they were only interested in enterprise level clients, so my comparatively tiny amount of SoundPad based messages weren't worth it to them. The same thing started happening with other providers as well. The free options we tried worked fine when they were working, but it was fairly common to get disconnects so we had to come up with another solution.</p><p>The solution, like most of this partnership, came from Merten. He had a small Linux server at home in Germany on which he had installed an XMPP server using the ejabberd software. We were concerned about the load and bandwidth that he would be personally maintaining so we decided to monitor it closely for the first few weeks. When it seemed like it wasn't going to melt down - actually it was fairly low-overhead, we relaxed a little.</p><p>And this is how it went for the next couple of years until, finally a bunch of things happened.</p><p>First, was that the ejabberd project went end-of-life and was no longer being updated with later versions of Fedora Linux (which Merten used for his other work). The second, was that Merten is a seriously busy person. During this entire collaboration he was working full time building software tools in assembly for corporate clients, and finishing a PhD. I don't think I ever asked him if he still had time for RPGs!</p><p>I ported the code over to a new free server at <a href="https://chatterboxtown.us">chatterboxtown.us</a>&nbsp;which seemed to be fairly stable -- it ran ejabbered on Ubuntu which, I guess was still being maintained. And That was that. It's been like this since June 2023. Broadcast still works, although I don't test it too much any more and I've stopped getting emails about it.</p><p>With the rise of Discord, and various apps and plugins to stream from that platform, plus virtual audio cables like Voicemeeter Banana, Sonar, Kenku FM, and others it all seemed like the technology had caught up and our little hacked together solution was becoming less and less viable. While there were still feature enhancements we could have made (including adding broadcast to the Custom SoundPad, there simply wasn't enough interest and these other tools had proven more than capable.</p><p>Broadcast is still running and probably will be until the latest server disappears. I have no idea how much it's being used, but I'm letting you all know that it's probably not going to be around forever and the good news is, there's so much better tech for this out there now that none of you should really mind.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div class="sc-e9471974-0 eLatQp"><div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/tabletopaudio/posts?filters%5Btag%5D=Broadcast" data-tag="post-tag" target="_blank" class="sc-39651d8c-0 ddnvOs"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK">Broadcast</p></a></div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/tabletopaudio/posts?filters%5Btag%5D=SoundPad" data-tag="post-tag" target="_blank" class="sc-39651d8c-0 ddnvOs"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK">SoundPad</p></a></div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a cm-GGZhvK"><div>i am one of the few that use Soundpad broadcasting! use it for several games, so i use it weekly. a great feature but totally understandable for it getting sunsetted.</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-6938f163-9 imwKue"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 BsKbD"><div class="sc-6938f163-8 fBebWH"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="like-button" type="button" aria-label="Like comment. 0 likes" aria-selected="false"><div class="sc-ffebfeb2-0 class="sc-6938f163-10 kDLTBP"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK"><time datetime="2025-05-29T18:37:45.360Z" cm-GGZhvK"><div>I honestly use kenku more than anything myself. The sound pads, i integrate into my foundry, and music i play locally because foundry's long-term audio sync is unreliable, so Doesn't super affect me personally, but i wanted to chime in in case folks are iffy on it, that Kenku is SIGNIFICANTLY easier to configure than VMB, and not to be afraid to give it a go as a substitute when the server finally sunsets. Really cool story and very impressive technical tool at any rate. Sucks they went for enterprise only :\ but anyway, Thanks for so much great music and hope this tip helps somebody.</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-6938f163-9 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-130101358">New Ambience: Drow Slave Camp</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-130101358" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 28</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rg2:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rg2:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>The Drow are the worst. Everyone seems to hate them. I know there was that one guy, but he seemed to be an outlier. On the other hand, are they kind of awesome in a love-to-hate-them kind of way? Sure, let's go with that.</p><p>When the blindfolds come off, you find yourself underground. The place reeks of sulfur, and suffering.  A cruel looking blue man hands you a pickaxe and points to a pile of rocks. "Make those smaller" he says, and kicks you in the back as you turn to walk away.</p><p>Drow Slave Camp is an awful place. Bamboo cages are full of various beings too weak or broken to work. The rest carry heavy loads, push carts full of rocks or just stack barrels from one side of the camp to the other. For every 10 wretched slaves there is an overseer - a Drow with a whip, or a club. They show very little restraint.</p><p>Musically, I wanted this to feel oppressive. Large drums seemed appropriate for the backbone. Strings, brass, basso profundo choir and pitched-down dulcimer complete the orchestration. </p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as music-only and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'empty' versions which remove the Drow and the slaves leaving just the environment. This might be useful for returning to the camp after your heroics (or...?)</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=130101358&amp;m=474117977" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-129522886">New Ambience: Light the Beacons</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-129522886" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 21</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rg9:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rg9:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This track has been kicking around for a while. It's been through lots of revisions and tweaks and I finally feel like I'm ready to move on. My working title for this was "Barry_thing" - because I thought the opening low strings riff sounded like a John Barry / Bond villain motif.  What it ended up being was more of a grandiose, wide-screen, action track.</p><p>Everything here is fairly typical orchestration. Strings, brass and percussion carry the biggest load, choir and a lead vocal line fill things out and help punch it up a notch when it needs it.</p><p>The ambience is set from the POV of one of the lighters of the beacons. They are up on the ridges looking down on the battle below. Distant crowd roars, sword clashes, pounding horses all reverberate from within the valley.</p><p>As this track is currently in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only and music only versions. Additionally, I added the most number of alternate versions - I think ever? </p><p>There are 2 'no swords' versions which keep the crowd sounds but remove the metal impacts. I thought it added a cool variation. Additionally, I created 2 'no battle' versions which remove all the voices and fighting completely, leaving just the beacons,  banners, war horns, and the wind.</p><p>I also went back and forth with the lead vocal section in the music. I like it, but it works slightly better as underscore without, so I created a 'no lead vox' variant.</p><p>Lastly, I picked out 3 sections that would make decent loops and included those as well. They are in both .ogg and .mp3 formats (ogg tends to loop better in some players) </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=129522886&amp;m=470509381" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-vampire-129348180">SoundPad: Vampire (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-vampire-129348180" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 19</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rrh:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rrh:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in the surreal time that was March of 2020, Vampire was the 25th SoundPad. I don't know if it came about because walking my dog in depopulated Brooklyn reminded me of old vampire films, or maybe it was because I had just had seen the first John Wick film. If you're scratching your head, here's what I said about it back then.<br></p><blockquote><p>I know what you're going to say. In John Wick movies, there are no vampires. Everyone is an assassin. But hear me out! They're all beautiful and well-dressed. There is a hierarchy, a system of government, regions, zones, rules - &nbsp;a high table. It's like everything I want from a vampire film, except vampirism. So, what if we just make them all vampires? All of a sudden everything came together.</p><p>The result is 40 sounds of modern urban action locations with 3 layerable tone tracks and 4 musical tracks with a focus on vampires. My hope is that there is enough diversity here to create a variety of stories.&nbsp;</p></blockquote><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Play the original <a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/vampire_sp.html">Vampire SoundPad online here.</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=129348180&amp;m=469429495" class="cm-pQxmHn class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-128949502">New Ambience: Petrified Forest</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-128949502" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 14</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rro:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rro:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>A barren landscape is always a great backdrop for adventure. But a once thriving landscape that has turned - wrong - is even better. A desert might always have been a desert, but a petrified forest begs the question: "what happened, and why?"</p><p>Here's an ambience of stone trees, stone leaves and branches scattered on the ground, a distant structure, also in ruin. Is this the domain of a single malevolent entity, or have a bunch of strange creatures moved in and called it home?  Wind howls, twists, and distorts amid the inflexible branches. Bits of petrified wood crack and clatter on the ground. Serpents warm themselves in the daytime sun. I rounded out the wildlife with vultures, some insects and a large beast of indiscriminate nature (you never see it). This could be a gorgon's lair,  or the domain of an ornery basilisk.</p><p>Musically, this began with an affected cimbalom (orchestral dulcimer). I then created 2 tracks of hard panned tagelharpa drone. Fujara flutes, tortured strings and analog synths bend around the landscape to create a vibe that's eerie and slightly threatening.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions of the track. Additionally, I created two 'no fauna' versions that remove the wildlife leaving just the pure ambience. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=128949502&amp;m=466916797" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-128381087" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 7</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rrv:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rrv:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Listening Post is a remote facility in the middle of nowhere. Nowhere could mean deep space, a desolated wilderness, or on one of the frozen poles (terrestrial or other). The point is that it's been there awhile. The amenities aren't great, and it's either just you,  or maybe a small handful of people running the place and trying to stay sane.</p><p>If this sounds like something out of Alien, or The Thing, then you get where I was going with this.</p><p>The ambience here is old, worn out tech. Mostly analog. The structure itself has a personality, and a small but expressive vocabulary consisting mostly of groans, thumps, and wheezes. The gear sputters, glitches and prints things out in hard copy.</p><p>I went back and forth on whether this was going to be set in outer space, or a frozen wasteland, but in the end it doesn't matter. You're only going outside if you absolutely have to. I think this track has pretty good utility for modern and scifi games - with horror as an option for either.</p><p>Musically this is what I would call 'horror-adjacent'. It could be scary, but it could also just be ominous, or intriguing. Low strings, pitchy vocals and  woodwinds (I used these instead of the usual brass for this  role) - flutes all the way down to contrabass clarinets. Timpani and some vintage synths round it all out.</p><p>As this track is currently in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here for Patrons. Additionally, I created 2 'no comms' versions in case the station isn't used for that, as well as 2 'no footsteps' versions. These will be most apparent in the ambience-only tracks. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=128381087&amp;m=463410372" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-desert-127990421" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 2</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rs6:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rs6:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in January 2020, Desert Planet was the 24th installment of the SoundPad series.</p><p>From the original post:</p><blockquote><p>As with many of these biome SoundPads, I add the word 'planet' after them to give me freedom from being slavishly realistic. Hence the dinosaurs in the jungle, giants in the ice etc.&nbsp;</p><p>I watched a lot of desert themed films while researching this. Lawrence of Arabia, Dune, Pitch Black and others. I found that the human element really helped to add to the story telling aspect of this world. There was only so much wind and shifting sand sounds that I could make and the temple was much needed interior element. As such, Desert Planet is quite heavily populated with humanoid tribes.&nbsp;</p><p>There are 3 tones which are useful for adding atmosphere to any desert based sounds. There are also 3 musical tracks which, while not authentic in any way, are consistent with the vibe for my particular world. I had a great time making my electric violin sound like a duduk, or ney for the Destiny track.</p></blockquote><p>Thank you all, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Play the original <a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/desert_planet_sp.html">Desert Planet SoundPad online here.</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=127990421&amp;m=460826209" class="cm-pQxmHn 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 title="2025-05-04T18:35:08.351+00:00">4mo</time></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="comment-body" class="sc-6938f163-7 kkfgbw"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK"><div>Changing the filenames for no purpose just breaks playlists and references in VTTs. It also means that the VTT wastes a ton of space telling you "Desert Planet" before the useful part of the filename can be displayed.</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-127817178">New Ambience: Foghaven</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-127817178" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>April 30</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rsd:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rsd:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Foghaven is a small industrial city in the north. It's in the foothills of a mountain range and, as its name implies, is perennially rainy and foggy. Despite it's dreary outward appearance, it's a very friendly place. The people work hard and they welcome (well behaved) travelers.</p><p>Foghaven could be a sister city for it's sunnier neighbor to the south, Goodhaven.  In fact - let's make that canon. It is. Who knows, maybe there will be additional 'havens'. Darkhaven comes to mind. Froghaven does not (<em>unless</em>...).</p><p>Musically this is expressive piano, strings and woodwinds. with a smattering of orchestral percussion. It has a slightly pushed feel even though the tempo is on the slower side. There are even a few dramatic builds which make it a useful exposition or exploration track. </p><p>The ambience is that of a busy small city. It could easily be the central square in a smaller village.</p><p>As this is currently in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only and ambience-only versions. In the mixed version of the track, I added rain because I thought that fit thematically, but I've also included 2 'no rain' versions for some extra utility.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=127817178&amp;m=459783456" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>462_Foghaven.mp3</a></span><span id="track-click"><a class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-127296025">New Ambience: Resurrection</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-127296025" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>April 23</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rsk:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rsk:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I have returned from our family trip to Madrid. It was my first time in Spain and it was amazing. What a truly wonderful city. I even managed to go to a few music shops and not come home with an extra suitcase full of toys! One of the best parts of travel is coming home, and in my case, getting back to the studio.</p><p>I started this track before I left, knowing that I'd have some time to think about it on the trip. The original music was sketched out, as well as a a bare bones winter ambience, but that was about it. The idea that started to form was of a magical ritual. Clerics maybe? Wizards? Doing...something. But, what?</p><p>Seeing as it was a snow and ice ambience, I couldn't get the idea of a woolly mammoth out of my head. But, instead of a living mammoth roaring and trumpeting across the tundra, I made this one frozen. As in - dead frozen.</p><p>Now I could have my mages, or warlocks or what have you attempting to resurrect this creature for good or evil. There would be some spell casting, some chanting, some careful chipping away at the ice binding the creature to the tundra.</p><p>Musically this is deep undulating drones, washed out, ambient guitars, synths and gently struck low orchestral percussion. I added a nyckelharpa to give it a bit of a northern vibe and act as a kind of lead 'voice'.</p><p>The ambience is frozen winds, chipping ice, crunching snow, chants and magical energy. </p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek , I've included the mixed-version, as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I created some variations of both the mixed and ambience only tracks. There are 'no magic', 'no chants', and 'no magic or chant' versions for added flexibility.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=127296025&amp;m=456393030" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-126287202" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>April 9</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rsr:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rsr:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Magical, quaint, slightly terrifying? We've all got opinions on Victorian Dolls. Especially in numbers.</p><p>So here we are, on a side street in London. A charming storefront with a murder of dolls in the window. (No, that's not the correct collective noun for dolls, but try and stop me from making it a thing.)</p><p>After hours, when the customers have gone and the employees have locked up, things begin to get a bit odd. Factions have formed. No one is sure if it's by dress length, hair color, or disposition. But sides are taken - as many as six. The whispering begins. Plans are formulated, tasks distributed. Throughout the night they move about in groups and create small diagrams out of ribbons. Outside, the rain and horse drawn carriages rattle the windows. By daylight, the dolls are back on the shelves.</p><p>Musically, this is romantic legato, and plucked strings, and a smattering of woodwinds, percussion, piano and choir. The whole thing is a bit dusty sounding, like an old attic, or a well loved record. I wanted it to be magical, but neutral. Like it could go in either direction.</p><p>I think this would make a good expository track, or even exploration/travel/downtime.</p><p>As this is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek, I've included the mixed version of the track, as well as ambience-only and music-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 'no voices' versions which remove the doll's whispers. Finally, as requested below I added a music and voices only version.I hope you find these additions useful.</p><p><strong>Important housekeeping note:</strong>&nbsp;My family and I are going to Madrid for a week on Saturday! Our oldest son has been studying there for the semester and none of us have ever been, so we decided now was as good a time as any. I'm very excited.</p><p>I'll be checking emails here and there but I'll obviously be away from the studio.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=126287202&amp;m=449490146" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/126065913/dc7415c73da34de2b977a50008bba6c4/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=2TJ5I2hgkQdInfDZn2tRGG9_pSYYDn3RuTN08VtV7tk%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 jZwAWM"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-fade-126065913">Tech Update: Player Fade-out.</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/tech-update-fade-126065913" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>April 6</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rt2:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rt2:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I finally got around to making a quality of life improvement to the ambience player. I know many of you have been requesting a better fade-out algorithm. The old behavior was an abrupt stop that could sometimes take players out of the mood. The tried and true method, as many of you know (sorry), was to manually ride down the volume slider and hit stop at the end. </p><p>The new format is a clean, logarithmic (starts quickly, ends slowly) 6 second fade when you hit the stop button. I tweaked the timing of this a bunch and I arrived at 6 seconds feeling right.</p><p><img data-media-id="447975997" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/126065913/50695a668fe14e5c9ee2d3cee43ca3e1/eyJ3ZWJwIjowfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=S5Sp-X9vJUaP1CtbUzVtdCEostV3fLLpNwQuYOANN-g%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"></p><p>If the player is hidden, the top bar stop button has the same effect, albeit with different visual feedback.</p><p><img data-media-id="447976053" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/126065913/da0dcc2e69c24153931ccd5376805098/eyJ3ZWJwIjowfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=3qaC9IjqOPTDixlWknR6JyD9d7jIBVPQ_kiPAJbHJ3I%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"></p><p>Fades are enabled by default. If you want to go back to the old abrupt method, simply click the new 'fade' led in the player itself. The current browser will remember your preferences. You'll need to redo the preferences on different browsers/machines.</p><p><strong>iOS Users:</strong>&nbsp;<em>This doesn't work on ipads/iphones. iOS works differently and does not allow for software control of volume so you won't see this new behavior.</em></p><p>I also know that many of you would like to have crossfading in the playlist. This is a much different situation and requires multiple audio streams at once which I've heard may be possible but is also basically a hack - and again, won't work on iOS.</p><p>Special thank you to patron <strong>Eric</strong>, who a) reminded me this was a requested feature, and b) Tested the result on multiple browsers/systems. Thank You Eric!</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><em>p.s. Apparently, you may need to shift+reload to get the 'fade' led to show up in the player.</em></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div class="sc-e9471974-0 eLatQp"><div><div class="sc-e9471974-1 guBukq"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/tabletopaudio/posts?filters%5Btag%5D=tech+update" data-tag="post-tag" target="_blank" class="sc-39651d8c-0 ddnvOs"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU I just start a new track. iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-125771154">New Ambience: Xenon Refinery</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-125771154" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>April 2</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rt9:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rt9:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I was noodling around on my Prophet synth last week and came up with a cool idea that I thought could work in a track. It was an interesting process as rather than sequencing everything I put on a click track and recorded the entire thing live. Not being highly quantized to a grid gave it a nice organic feel, but adding things on top of it proved to be a bit challenging. On top of the synth track, there's piano, flautando strings, some deep percussion and a few synth drums that are pushed way back, to give a bit of movement.</p><p>The part that I think sells it, however, is the synth/dulcimer part that lends the whole piece a vaguely ethnic vibe. I experimented with a lot of different sounds in this one and I think it ended up sounding pretty cool. </p><p>For the ambience, I knew I wanted it to be a planet exterior with some massive gas extracting towers, belching vapour into the air.  Xenon is apparently quite rare on earth so I picked that rather arbitrarily.  Or maybe it was because words that start with 'X' are cool and give instant scifi credibility. </p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions of the track here. Additionally, I created two 'No Towers' versions that make it a barren planet surface ambience. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=125771154&amp;m=445914048" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-GGZhvK"><div>When you said that you had just chosen Xenon because it sounded cool (which is true), I kept thinking about how you would refine Xenon and since Xenon is produced during the fission of href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-125222609">New Ambience: Deep Blue</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-125222609" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>March 26</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rtg:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rtg:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I love underwater adventures. I've created several ambiences over the years, and a couple of SoundPads (Deep Six and Atlantis). But, like taverns and dungeons, I always want more.</p><p>Deep Blue follows a submersible craft as it navigates through kelp forests, trenches, and ancient civilizations.  I would say it's fairly genre agnostic. It would work equally well in scifi, or fantasy.  And, nothing about the tech would be out of place in a modern situation.</p><p>The water ambient effects are subtly treated to give them a bit of an otherworldly presence. I worked with the cavitation sounds quite a bit, and found that mapping a midi controller to their pitch allowed me to 'drive' the craft more believably.</p><p>Musically, this is mostly synths and processed strings, with a bit of brass. It's all very <em>floaty</em>. I think it conveys a sense of adventure and possibility, more than danger.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, while I was working on this I couldn't decide on the size of the craft. I ended up making a version with a smaller craft (higher pitched engine, smaller propellers) and I included those versions as well. There are also 2 no-craft version. These are all fairly subtle changes, especially when the music is playing, but I think in their ambience only form they'll be quite useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=125222609&amp;m=442227161" class="cm-pQxmHn mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/124869963/553f10473e864f21b26f672e7397fb60/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=lQbT0HcFUzQwVloof0qbzWN56HrPI1yZ-44iBKzeYKQ%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 iRSVba"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-ice-124869963">SoundPad: Ice Planet (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-ice-124869963" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>March 21</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rtn:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rtn:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in October, 2019 Ice Planet was the 23rd installment of the SoundPad series and the 3rd of what I began to call the *Planet series. These were designed originally as singular biomes within which to tell stories. However, I didn't want to be limited to realistic sounds, so the 'Planet' suffix freed me from having to think terrestrially </p><p>Interestingly, I went back to the original post and seems like the 'planet' suffix was also a way to combat creative block:</p><blockquote><p>When I first got the idea for this, I created a series of wind sounds, the low constant drone wind, the fearsome blizzard wind, then the interior cave wind and then - &nbsp;I got stuck. I thought I'd made a mistake picking this setting because I literally couldn't think of anything other than winds to be on this planet. And, ice. I added some ice sounds.</p><p>After another bout of sound designer block, I then I decided to think about what-ifs. What if there was a dungeon here? Maybe it has doors. Maybe a door could be a giant snow boulder that you roll across an opening? Maybe you've got a horse, or some kind of snow beast that you ride. Who or what else could be here?</p><p>This is why the word &nbsp;'planet' gets added to many of the SoundPad names. It gives me a way to get 'unstuck'. Freed from the boundaries of creating something actual I can be a little more creative and bend some of the rules.</p></blockquote><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Play the <a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/ice_planet_sp.html">original Ice Planet SoundPad online here</a>.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=124869963&amp;m=439719212" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" class="sc-6938f163-8 fBebWH"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-label="Reply to comment"><span title="Reply to class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/124652369/8dd4c40ccb2a432faf52cdb45af8636a/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=K08_27n2BVmS4La63CWRdITq3y_jKycaaFA_upe_D-I%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 jRRtHs"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-124652369">New Ambience: Hunting Grounds</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-124652369" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>March 19</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rtu:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rtu:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>The genesis of this track was a simple piano part that I ran into a fuzz pedal. In this case, a clone of the legendary Shin-ei Fuzz-wah (minus the wah) made by British maker Fredric Effects. I'm trying to incorporate more analog external effects into music lately as I just love how unpredictable they can be on various sources. But back to the piano - it was the start of the track, but not the basis. It was the guitar part that I latched onto and made me want to flesh it out. More distortion pedals for that of course! Plus some excellent in-the-box distortion and saturation plugins. I especially loved how gritty the low string pulses became.</p><p>The other central element was electric violin. In general, I have a bit of a dislike-loathe relationship with electric violins. In my band days they were often necessary to combat feedback on loud stages, but I never thought they never sounded very good. In this case I played it <em>sul tasto</em>&nbsp;(on the fingerboard). a popular orchestral technique that gives strings a raspy, breathy tone. In this case it almost sounds like a duduk.</p><p>Once all those things were in place it was just a matter of finding balance with all the low end energy that was getting amplified. I think I tamed it - mostly.</p><p>I'm not sure at which point I thought about dragons. The music has a bit of melancholy, but it's also got a lot of latent power. I think the process of taming the wildness of the distorted elements is what led me to dragons. The melancholic elements could easily be transformed into solitude, hence a lone dragon, hunting in a valley, viewed from a clifftop.</p><p>The ambience here is blustery cliffs, distant rumbling thunder, scree fall and of course, a dragon on the wing moving about the valley.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 'No Dragon' versions for some general style blustery ambience.</p><p>More additionally, I went back to the original piece and extracted 2 loops  that are presented in both .ogg and .mp3 format. The loops are mostly the same except loop 1 retains the more melodic piano part and loop 2 does not. </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=124652369&amp;m=438670450" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/124210541/639fd843eea9447bbc3794bd51e73fae/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=rfKw9eocpEwPebTQhlrPwVJlyBesnUlBy_-pSjLBovY%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 kRdKXG"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-124210541">New Ambience: Drawing Room: Night</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-124210541" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>March 12</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":ru5:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":ru5:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>The drawing room was the hub of all activity in manor houses. It was here that guests were received, families gathered after meals, games were played, and even small concerts. Salons, parlors, living rooms and state rooms are all based on the human need for congregation. They are places where stories are made.  Announcements, confessions, betrayals, rumors, and plans - they all begin here.</p><p>But what happens at the end of the evening, when the last person puts down their brandy and calls it a night? At some point it's the job of the butler to close everything down. Doors closed, cabinets locked, fire tended, and lamps doused.</p><p>Drawing Room: Night is the end of such an evening. The weather outside is dreadful, but the fire is still warm, and the butler goes about his duties.</p><p>The ambience is an interior perspective of a storm. Windows rattle, and wind seeps through small gaps making the lights flicker. There's a warm fire and the sounds of footsteps, and occasional distant thumps. A perfect setting for a romantic tryst, a secret meeting, or a burglary.</p><p>Musically this isn't period accurate, but the vibe seemed right. Piano, strings, woodwinds,  and celeste weave around each other, tracing a fine line between spooky and calm. There's vampire stories here. Gothic romance and intrigue as well. I think it would make a fine background track for a variety of non-action situations.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as ambient-only,  and music-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'no butler' tracks that make it even emptier. Finally, I extracted a modified solo piano loop from the piece that you can use as an interstitial segment, or however you like. The loop is included as ogg and mp3. Ogg usually loops a bit more seamlessly but use whichever one works best. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=124210541&amp;m=435110165" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-123708962">New Ambience: Harper's Waypoint</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-123708962" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>March 5</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":ruc:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":ruc:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This track started out as a tavern, viewed from the outside, but slowly morphed into a secret hideaway in the forest. I thought a Harper's Hideaway away would be a pretty good title, but I went with 'waypoint' because it seemed more like a destination known only to a select few.</p><p>In fairness, this <em>is</em>&nbsp;a tavern. Harper's come here to relax between assignments, fix gear, tell stories, replenish supplies, and keep the house and gardens in repair. the scene is set in the early evening so there a birds and insects, the occasional frog, and an owl. The Harper's speak outside in hushed tones and you can hear the muffled sounds of more coming from within.</p><p>Musically, this is mostly medieval style/fantasy instruments. Baroque guitar, zither, nyckelharpa, tagelharpa, viola da gamba, flutes and hand drums. These are augmented by more traditional orchestral instruments to make it a bit more <em>wide screen</em>.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I created 2 'no voices' versions which are subtle, but remove the exterior and interior voices (leaving the outdoor activities and horses etc). I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=123708962&amp;m=431644585" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci
