data-tag="loadMoreCommentsCta" type="button">Load more comments</button></div></div><div><div class="sc-622cce91-4 jCAlpp"><div class="sc-622cce91-0 fLpUxG"><div class="sc-d64f4737-0 joDoFb"><div class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-weirder-123540396">SoundPad: Weirder Things (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-weirder-123540396" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>March 3</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":ruj:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":ruj:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in July 2019, Weirder Things was something of an inevitability for me as a) I was a huge fan and had already done 2 ambiences and b) So many people requested it.</p><p>Here are my thoughts from the original release:</p><blockquote><p>Many of you are already familiar with my love of the TV show Stranger Things, and especially the music. Any excuse to do a synth only, knob tweaking analog music track I will take it. &nbsp;I've done 2 10 minute tracks on the front page of the site, each one coinciding with a season of the show. For season 3 I assumed I was going to repeat the process and then I thought...wait a minute! There's a SoundPad in here!</p><p>As a child of the 80s there's so much nostalgia to sift through on the show. I re-watched season 1 as that was the season that established the time period. &nbsp;I coupled that with my own sound memories and then took it from there.</p><p>This is more of a Stranger Things SoundPad than a generic 80s one as there are elements specific to the show. Creatures, alternate universes, isolation tanks etc. I'm hoping that there's enough utility here to add to many different types of games, even modern ones. The sounds of suburbia honestly haven't changed that much have they?</p><p>There are 40 sounds in this SoundPad including 6 tones, the largest number yet. Each of these can be used individually to create a specific atmosphere or can be layered in any combination to create new beds and moods. I love just setting the 'Boom Tone' track over a simple background for instant suspense.</p><p>There are also 4 musical tracks that I composed in the style of the show, not necessarily the 80s. I'm pretty happy with the way they turned out. </p></blockquote><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Play the original <a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/weirder_things_sp.html">Weirder Things SoundPad online here</a>.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=123540396&amp;m=430610714" class="cm-pQxmHn bXfylT"></div><div id="content-card-comment-thread-container" data-tag="content-card-comment-thread-container"><div class="sc-fa9f7313-0 hoAOSY"><div class="sc-fa9f7313-3 iLHgsC"><div><div class="sc-622cce91-4 jCAlpp"><div class="sc-622cce91-0 fLpUxG"><div class="sc-d64f4737-0 joDoFb"><div class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Start the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/123162336/8c622f109f4f4b28966f4ebcd629cd0b/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=wAKIoKxNQbwArPleU1uxmSisomiNMmlHRJkreQhPPFI%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 grFbiV"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-123162336">New Ambience: Broken Pantheon</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-123162336" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>February 26</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":ruq:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":ruq:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I was playing around with reverb recently. In particular, chaining a few different types together to see what combinations of sound I could get. Eventually I created this massive space that was fed by some shorter modulated reverbs. I thought it sounded like a cavernous stone interior, but warmer, and a bit...other.</p><p><em>Broken Pantheon</em>&nbsp;is a massive, multi-level, stone structure with a huge amount of negative space in the interior. This space could have once housed the statue of a god, but now it's in ruins.  </p><p>The ambience features interior winds howling around columns, rats, debris, lit braziers, whispered spirit vocals, and various distant clinks and clunks. The aforementioned reverb blurs and elongates everything in a lovely and eerie way. </p><p>The music here is mostly treated string drones morphed with bowed cymbals, low strings, some brass, a cimbalom, a synthesized zither thing and various orchestral metals and percussion.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created two 'no whispers' versions for when your party inevitably purges the spirits.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-and-122635014">New Ambience: Capes and Canes</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-and-122635014" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>February 19</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rv1:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rv1:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This track is a couple of different things. On the ambience side It's a Victorian-era cityscape complete with Hansom cabs, horses, pedestrians and rain. On the music side it has a slightly sinister, slightly goofy, stealthy / pursuit / peering out of doorways type of vibe.</p><p>I recently purchased a new microphone preamp/EQ,  so I thought that recording multiple tracks of live instruments was just the thing to put it through its paces. Violins, viola, and multiple percussion instruments are combined with sampled instruments: Piano, choir, woodwinds, string section, marimba  and crotales.</p><p>I honestly didn't think too much about which instruments, and why, I went with the vibe first and if it sounded good - it stayed in.</p><p>I went back and forth on the title. "London Fog", "Victorian Pursuit" etc.. would all have worked. I just liked Capes and Canes as it sounded like a game I could see myself playing. Is it already a game? I didn't even look!</p><p>I think this would work in a lot of genres. Steampunk, fantasy, certainly anything vampire. There's a bit of a Jack the Ripper/deadly gentleman thing going on as well.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon exclusive sneak peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as ambience-only and music-only versions. Additionally, I've included 2 'no rain' versions for flexibility. I also went back at the last minute and created an ambience-only version with no rain and no (main) footsteps.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>February 14</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rv8:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rv8:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in June of 2019, Hell Planet was a mash-up between <em>Mad Max: Fury Road</em>, and the then-upcoming D&amp;D module <em>Decent into Avernus</em>. It's a combat forward SoundPad which includes many vehicle/engine sounds and vehicular based weapons.</p><p>If you're simulating the Blood War or post apocalyptic carmegeddon, this should have you covered.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Play with the <a href="http://tabletopaudio.com/hell_planet_sp.html">original Hell Planet SoundPad</a>&nbsp;here.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 dBXsDD"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-122129525">New Ambience: The Last Express</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-122129525" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>February 12</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rvf:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rvf:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Train stations, like their sci-fi cousins space stations, are amazing story generators. Stories can begin, develop and end in them. Arrivals and departures are meaningful events. Crowds can act en masse, like a school of fish,  or individually and chaotically. You can lose yourself (or someone else) amidst the throngs. Holding everything together is time. The ebb and flow of people and machinery are all beholden to a schedule.</p><p>In this track, an unknown event is pushing people to scramble for the final train. It could be war, the threat of invasion, pandemic, aliens, anything. Whatever the reason, they've got to be on that train, and it's getting dicey.</p><p>There's a noir vibe to this but I'd say it's definitely not classic noir. The ambience here is an agitated crowd, various station sounds, and of course, trains. The trains are steam trains but it could absolutely pass for a modern era station.</p><p>Musically, this is a hybrid score. It's mostly orchestral, but synths play a big part as well. I'd call it an 'action-light' track. Suitable for escapes, chases and general upbeat scenes. I think it would work in just about any genre.</p><p>As this is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here. Additionally, I created two 'calmer' versions which remove the agitated crowd leaving it more of a standard bustling station. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=122129525&amp;m=420913241" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-orb-121583268">New Ambience: Orb of Doom</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-orb-121583268" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>February 5</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":rvm:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":rvm:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Let's just start with the title: My working title was "Slowly Rotating Sphere of Prophecy", which obviously wasn't going to fit on the website. I kept it that way as I worked because I wanted it to be a neutral sounding thing and not necessarily evil. At least - not capital-E Evil. The premise was a magical orb, bristling with energy, that had to be controlled by monks whose growls, chants and vocalizations kept it from getting out of control.</p><p>Yes, the title had to be shortened and I hesitatingly chose the word <em>doom</em>, because it has 4 letters. I mean, it could be doom-y, but it doesn't have to be. Remember, I always tell you not to get too attached to my names and descriptions. Use them how you want!</p><p>Musically, this has bendy, ruined synths, chattering live strings and piano over big drums and orchestral pulses. It could easily pass as sci-fi.</p><p>The ambience features the throbbing orb (ooh, missed title opportunity...), energy discharges, interior chamber noises, and monks.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'no monks' versions (<em>but Tim, how will the sphere maintain magical cohesion without the monks to control it? - That's because without the monks, it's now a sci-fi reactor! Or maybe it never even needed the monks!!</em>). I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=121583268&amp;m=417269024" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/121276336/1cec3e5e7a8649a2bc968cc9e566ff3b/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=UH8XHyk9tRSFxQTjXT74md7nF9TG9S7pRyqV1BhtQO8%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 irrnwP"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-alien-121276336">SoundPad: Alien Starship (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-alien-121276336" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>February 1</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r19e:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r19e:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in April 2019. Here are my thoughts from its original release:</p><blockquote><p>I see this as a companion piece to the original <em>Starship</em>&nbsp;SoundPad, in which we take things in a darker direction. My creative brief to myself was that this was either an alien craft, or some kind of derelict ship or facility that had been inhabited by hostile creatures. Obviously my inspiration comes from the the original 1979 Ridley Scott film <em>Alien</em>&nbsp;- and somewhat from the James Cameron 1986 sequel <em>Aliens</em>. I also watched films like <em>Pitch Black</em>, <em>Europa Report</em>, <em>Event Horizon</em>&nbsp;and others. The subject of the film is often not as important as a single scene or situation that i can recreate with a few sounds.</p><p>The sounds here are split between high tech and organic. All the wind and drone sounds, and even the thunder were created on a synthesizer to give them &nbsp;that slightly 'off', other worldly feeling. I also wanted the sounds to feel less polished in keeping with the period the movie was made. For the alien creature sounds I went the opposite of synthesized/artificial and started with organic sounds and twisted them just to the point where I felt like I was losing the original source.&nbsp;</p><p>Jerry Goldsmith's score for Alien is a masterpiece and has been imitated countless times. In an era of romantic and melodic cues, he instead chose tone, timbre and dissonance to create a disjointed unease. The musical track 'Tension' is a deep (apologetic) bow to Jerry's score.</p><p>In addition to the 2 musical tracks there are 5 tone tracks which can be combined to create subtle underscore.</p></blockquote><p>Thank you all, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p>Listen to the <a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/alien_starship_sp.html">original Alien Starship </a>SoundPad here</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=121276336&amp;m=415193595" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-121047059">New Ambience: Nightlands</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-121047059" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 29</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r19l:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r19l:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This week I created an atmospheric, moody location that I called Nightlands. It could be 'ruined lands', or 'shadow lands', or any number of permanently twilight, partially destroyed environments, brimming with dark magic.</p><p>In my mind, this is a world which was once vibrant, but destroyed by a cataclysmic event.  As such, the fabric between our world and Nightlands has been torn and it's possible to travel between them.</p><p>The ambience here is barren and windy. Leafless trees creak and sway. Dust motes swirl around the crumbled ruins of buildings. Small bands of scavenging creatures vie for survival. An adventurer would only come here by choice if there were riches to be found. Or answers.</p><p>Musically this is ambient/chaotic. Instruments swirl, rise, and crash like the Nightlands wind. String clusters, brass, tortured orchestral sounds, synths, and twisted vocal melodies match the ambience. It's calm and energetic at the same time.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week)  as well as music-only and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 'calm' versions which aren't really calm at all, but they do tone down some of the howling winds. I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=121047059&amp;m=413677256" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/120554544/922ff7945c73409f94845d27005272c9/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=Bk3YJxqsKNDVI44WqCU3e5YWL2PHIojsPwDFsbtALKY%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-120554544">New Ambience: A Royal Visit</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-120554544" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 22</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r19s:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r19s:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This track fell squarely into the 'I've written some music...but what is it?" categories. More importantly, 'where is it?' </p><p>At the beginning of the week I didn't let it get to me. I continued to write, edit and orchestrate the arrangement. As often happens, vibes emerged. I didn't fully grasp it at the beginning, but I couldn't shake the notion of royalty from this one. It's not fanfares and fireworks, it's even a bit dour at the start, but I think it evolves into something more triumphant - something regal.</p><p>From there, I developed a scenario where a royal retinue arrives in a city. It could be as returning heroes, or newly minted conquerors. There are horses and soldiers and maybe even a palanquin if we're feeling fancy.</p><p>People line the streets. Some cheer, many simply go about their business. There's a sense of exposition here. Something from which everything else emerges.</p><p>Musically, this is traditional orchestra top to bottom. Sweeping strings, stentorian brass, agile woodwinds and martial percussion on top.</p><p>The ambience is a medieval city, or large town. There's a sense of levity to the crowd. They are expectant, joyous, maybe a bit concerned. It's a fine general purpose city ambience.</p><p>As this is in Patreon exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed-version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only and music-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 "No Applause" versions which remove the cheers and clapping form the sidelines which give it a bit more general utility. I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=120554544&amp;m=410202633" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>449_A_Royal_Visit.mp3</a></span><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=120554544&amp;m=410202798" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 1.152C4.5 5.155 4.5 7.02 4.5 10.5v3c0 3.75 0 5.625.938 6.563C6.375 21 8.25 21 12 21c3.75 0 5.625 0 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>449_A_Royal_Visit_No_Applause.mp3</a></span><span id="track-click"><a Sorry to ask, I don't know if you do requests or not, or take inspiration from comments etc. but figured I'd try. I've been running some Regency Cthulhu games, and was hoping to get into some other games like Good Society and Our Brilliant Ruin. These all often contain ballroom scenes or dances, masques, etc. The Regency scenario I'm running opens at the town's annual Michaelmas Ball, for example. So far I'd been using a few ambiences like Elegant Dinner Party or Royal Salon then overlaying them with some period-appropriate dance music from Youtube. Anyway, if the muse takes you I was hoping you might make a track for a ballroom or dance someday. Thank you so much for making all of this. They're been so good to have in the background for my games. </div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-6938f163-9 imwKue"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 BsKbD"><div cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-combat-120267025" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 18</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1a3:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1a3:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: I forgot to include the .jpg of the cover in the .zip file. This has been added to the .zip, and also as a stand alone so you don't need to re-download it. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in January of 2019, "Combat: Siege" was a continuation of the Combat series which differed slightly from the location/biome dependent SoundPads in that they were more focused on action than background. The original "Combat" SoundPad was a classic 'sword and board' style medieval fighting simulator. It was modernized later with "Combat:Future" which featured modern/sci-fi style weapons and scenarios. "Combat:Siege" goes back to the medieval style but focuses on a larger scale.</p><p>This is a particularly large set as there are so many one-shot sounds that were split into individual sounds.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/combat_siege_sp.html">Combat:Siege SoundPad online (original version)</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-120064511">New Ambience: Checkpoint Omega</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-120064511" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 15</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1aa:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1aa:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>There was a scene in the beginning of the Star Wars film 'Solo' (which I enjoyed, and has a great soundtrack) where Han and Q'ira are trying to escape their pursuers and are at a military checkpoint waiting in queue. The scene is busy and tense. Will they get to the window in time? Will the be allowed to pass? There's very little action, but a lot of tension.</p><p>I love scenes like this in games and stories because they make time stand still. So many things can happen - internally and externally. </p><p>The music is modern film/tv underscore with a bit more teeth. It's designed to push a bit, while still making the time dilate. Synths, drums and dash of ostinato strings. It's modern but not too sci-fi or cyberpunk that it couldn't be used more broadly. It would make a good sub-action/tension track.</p><p>The ambience is a crowded reverberant space. Beeps, passing ships outside, repair crews, announcements and soldiers on patrol all add to the oppressiveness of the situation.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'no PA'  versions which remove the announcements.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=120064511&amp;m=406674115" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 11</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1ah:">Show class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: I had left out a single sound "Male Laugh Dist 4". This has been added to the original .zip file and also as a separate download if you just needed the one file. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in October, 2018, "Castle Raven" was my first foray into gothic horror. It was also a not-very-subtle nod to the D&amp;D modules for Ravenloft and Curse of Strahd. Many of the sounds within are based on descriptions from those books.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/castle_raven_sp.html">Castle Raven SoundPad Link (original ver.)</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-119577347">New Ambience: The Murky Depths</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-119577347" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 8</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1ao:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1ao:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>My idea for this one was an underground environment that was intensely humid, and bursting with life. I imagined tribes of indigenous hunter gatherers scouting for copious flora and fauna. Small bands of raiders attacking other settlements for resources or to secure better hunting grounds. Occasionally a small band of adventurers from topside would find their way down. Maybe it had to do with the cavern full of sparkling red stones?</p><p>The ambience here is different than most underground/cavernous locations. Those are usually desolate and barren. In The Murky Depths you can feel the ground moving under your feet, plants growing  almost visibly in the dim filtered light.</p><p>The music is an atmospheric blend of low drums and metallic percussion performed in a way that's more ambient than rhythmic. It's other worldly, but not quite alien. Occasional voices and low woodwinds pierce the wash of sound to create an organic feel. I think the music only version would make a good background for a wide variety of genres, including sci-fi and horror.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I created two 'less murk' versions which remove some of the loamy squelch and stream sounds, creating a more traditional underground atmosphere.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=119577347&amp;m=403264888" class="cm-pQxmHn data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/119091002/b0c76a92ef14430c9431a9da0e687862/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=LW3HkaqKim4qdBoCDxo6w4j65rCeD0ppkEaVROlOnDI%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 bihUnY"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-119091002">New Ambience: Between Adventures</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-119091002" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>January 1</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1av:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1av:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Happy New Year! I hope you had a safe and joyous holiday season. I managed to sneak away to my studio more than I thought I might. Mostly I did lots of boring things like upgrade hard drives, tidy cabling and some basic sprucing. Between all that, I even managed to write some music.</p><p>This is a downtime ambience, meaning it's betwixt and between. A liminal space. It's about waiting. It's about <em>not</em>&nbsp;slaying things or exploring ruins. You and your party are at a tavern. You're not entirely happy about it. Maybe you're waiting for news. You occupy the time as best you can. Sharpening your blades, drinking, playing games, fidgeting with gear.</p><p>The ambience is a quiet tavern. There are other patrons here, perhaps a room away. As I mentioned above, you and your party occupy yourselves as best you can. Don't worry, the front door will open with good news or bad news. Either way, you'll be off again soon.</p><p>Musically this fairly gentle and meandering and would make a good peaceful backdrop for a variety of settings. It's a mix of tavern style instrumentation and some traditional orchestral instruments. Live percussion and tagelharpa mixed with chamber strings, woodwinds, dulcimer, harp and piano.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I created two 'No Party' versions which remove the foreground activities and leave the tavern background voices and fireplace ambience. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=119091002&amp;m=399799868" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-118489812">SoundPad: Steampunk (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-118489812" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Dec 22, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1b6:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1b6:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in June of 2018, here's what I wrote about it back then:</p><blockquote><p>This was a tough one. Do I say that every time? I think I do. Steampunk, like Film Noir, is an extremely visual genre. Everyone has some idea of what it looks like, but sounds, as it turns out, are a different story.</p><p>I started with the basics. I decided that I needed a toolkit with which to build machines. So I recorded and assembled lots of mechanical sounds. Ticks, hits, clangs, the works. &nbsp;Then I thought about iconic locations. An airship, a booksellers/antiquarian dealer, a Victorian street corner. Slowly it started to come together.&nbsp;</p><p>Accent sounds abound in this. A simple addition of say, a bubbling flask to a bookshop makes it an instant laboratory. &nbsp;A propeller sound added to any contraption, makes it fly.</p><p>Of the 3 musical tracks, I wrote two - Organ Music (borrowed heavily from A. Badalamenti) and Bells Music. The Accordion Music track is from a 1924 78rpm recording by Galli Rini (public domain) that I cleaned up (a lot) and looped a section of. I thought it was perfect.</p><p>This is the largest SoundPad to date, with 40 sounds. 4 of which are tones. You'll definitely want to go with the less-is-more approach here. Adding all the machine sounds into one mega-machine is going to sound too busy. Try various combinations of 2 or 3 sounds to start.</p></blockquote><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=118489812&amp;m=395420778" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-118234333" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Dec 18, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1bd:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1bd:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I was playing around designing a rumble sound last week. I thought it came out pretty well so I designed an entire track around it.</p><p>Lava King is a boss. Like all bosses who live in subterranean caverns, he's mean - but also a bit lonely. He really (really) looks forward to visitors. He doesn't treat them very well though. He's a bit of a jerk actually.  </p><p>The ambience here is the aforementioned rumble sound, plus various bubbly, viscous liquids that sounded molten. I created the Lava King's voice with my own (plus a ton of effects) and piped some rock smashes/liquid hits through the same effect chain for his footsteps.</p><p>Musically, this is powerful low strings, scraped metals, massive low thumps, overblown brass and a bit of basso profundo choir. Oh, and synths. It's not necessarily an action track - but it isn't not one either. </p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed track, as well as music-only&nbsp;versions here. Additionally, I created two 'No King' versions which remove the central character and leave the lava cavern. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><blockquote><p><em>Housekeeping Update:</em>&nbsp;Next week there will be no track as I'll be bracing for the imminent arrival of family and cooking etc. I'm not entirely sure If there will be another by the end of the year but I'll keep you posted. I'd like to at least get another remastered SoundPad finished.</p></blockquote><p>Thank you all for joining me in 2024, I could not do any of this without your support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=118234333&amp;m=393618747" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 A question that I don't know where else to post: is there a way to search by emotional mood? kkfgbw"><p class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK"><div>A couple of ways: The easiest, but not very thorough is to use the search bar on the TTA home page. This connects with a small 'dictionary' that has some basic descriptions. It's far from complete but I basically pick 8-12 words for every track.

A MUCH more complete resource is from Twitch streamer Koibu (Neal) who has an online spreadsheet that he generously shares:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pn4zBP-aTzh59YznbOD8WBb21p3XpdC3WGifQDYvI-c/edit?gid=1131104914#gid=1131104914</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-6938f163-9 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-film-117966924">SoundPad: Film Noir (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-film-117966924" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Dec 14, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1bk:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1bk:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in April, 2018, Film Noir was the result of lots of film watching and note taking.  Films like Laura, The Maltese Falcon, Chinatown, Touch of Evil and others were all used as inspiration.</p><p><em>From the original post:</em></p><p>I ended up designing 36 sounds (culled from 65) that I thought worked well together and were able to describe several different types of indoor and outdoor environments that could serve as a backdrop. Many of the sounds come from my own field recordings in NYC where I live. I also did a cocktail mixing Foley session from which the 'pour whiskey' sound emerged.</p><p>The two musical tracks I composed for this are both moody. <em>Dark City</em>&nbsp;is an homage to Jerry Goldsmith in that it uses his signature harp sound from the Chinatown Soundtrack. As soon as I heard a minor harp chord being strummed I knew I could sell the vibe. <em>Cool City</em>&nbsp;is a vibey piano, trumpet , bass and drums piece that I thought sounded - smokey - for a lack of a better word.</p><p>For this one, I replaced the usual tone section with 'stings'. You'll know how and when to use these as soon as you hear them. I tried many different types of loopable and layered tones but found that musical stings were much better suited for this. They're great for both punctuation and transitions.</p><p>Thank you, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=117966924&amp;m=391775300" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 1.152C4.5 5.155 4.5 7.02 4.5 10.5v3c0 3.75 0 5.625.938 6.563C6.375 21 8.25 21 12 21c3.75 0 5.625 0 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>Film_Noir_SoundPad.zip</a></span></div></div><div data-tag="post-tags"><div href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-117772638">New Ambience: Yuletide Cantrips</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-117772638" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Dec 11, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1br:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1br:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>As usual, I didn't start out writing anything in particular. Definitely not this holiday-adjacement music. But that's what came out! I'm not even sure why this seems so seasonal. Maybe sticking a glockenspiel, harp and cimbalom together just makes it happen? I need to look into this.</p><p>So here we are, in a large fantasy city, and it's festival time. Everyone is out on the streets and the local mages have put aside their internecine bickering and have agreed to entertain the masses with a show of light and color. Light and sparks shoot from their fingers and coil majestically in the air, swirling into shapes before erupting into dazzling clouds. </p><p>Musically, this is all about the cimbalom - a concert dulcimer. The part is doubled on lute and then a string orchestra adds movement. Tagelharpa, percussion and woodwinds and choir round it out.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed-version of the track (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only and music-only versions here. Additionally, I created two 'no firework' versions which remove both the cantrips and the crowd reactions. This makes it more of a generic cityscape which could be useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=117772638&amp;m=390471577" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci
