data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/117297206/f717a139f5aa46fa88050adca301bd96/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=MqkRwgfymBntMX2lTrOCR0Gy5Xj1rCifa4aHT5LDx1o%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 knrXx"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-lab-117297206">New Ambience: Primate Lab</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-lab-117297206" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Dec 4, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1c2:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1c2:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Sometimes in the process of noodling around you stumble across something that makes you say, 'there's something here, but I don't know what it is yet'. This is exactly what happened when I created a synth patch that made me blurt out: "John Carpenter!".</p><p>As any sane and right minded individual knows, the man is a treasure. Not just as a writer/directory, but as a composer/synthesist as well. My track "Outpost 31" was a studied and shameless homage to him (as well as to 'The Thing'). But this sound wasn't aping (oof, sorry) him directly  it was more John Carpenter-esque. As in, it's something he might approve of, but didn't necessarily do.</p><p>The point is, I ran with it. Instead of doubling down on the whole JC aesthetic, I just continued to write and see where it took me. Well - turns out it didn't take me too far away from the JC vibe I had started with! </p><p>Primate Lab is a classic sci-fi trope that works with vintage/modern/future stories. It's got creepy white disinfected surfaces, metal cages and horrible lighting. And, probably people wearing weird blue shoe coverings. </p><p>Why are screeching monkeys such a great way of foreshadowing events that main story characters aren't aware of yet? (*spoiler alert: They're a lot like us)</p><p>The ambience is various lab background sounds combined with the gentle hum of my refrigerator and the buzz of fluorescent lighting. Animal sounds and various metallic clangs make up most of the foreground activity.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed-version (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I created 2 'no primate' versions for the all important scene when character 1 turns to character 2 and says: "where are all the monkeys?" I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=117297206&amp;m=387399589" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-116832180">New Ambience: Darkmoor</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-116832180" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Nov 27, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1c9:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1c9:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Before I drop everything and begin cooking for tomorrow's Thanksgiving dinner, I present to you the (usually) sleepy (and totally made up) county of Darkmoor. Darkmoor is in the moorlands, or moors, which if you've seen the horror classic "An American Werewolf in London" is a place you certainly shouldn't be wandering around after dark. I've always loved that film and I wanted to do something with a similar vibe.</p><p>This is a horror/action track that has a slow build from spooky to breathless and back again. Musically, it's mostly orchestral but I did add some guitar and sound design-y bits to spice things up here and there.</p><p>The ambience is low lying brush, evil wind, a few dead trees, some angry crows and a large, shadowy beast that you never get a very good look at. All the foreground bits have a slight delay effect that I thought enhanced the sense of 'wrongness' about the place.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've attached the mixed-version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions to the bottom of this post. Additionally, I created 2 'Carriage' versions in which the POV is dashing through the moors via horse-drawn carriage. I also created 2 'No Monster' versions which remove our lunaphilic**&nbsp;friend<em>. </em>I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p><em>**</em>&nbsp;<em>note: apparently,&nbsp;this isn't a word, but boy should it be&nbsp;.</em></p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=116832180&amp;m=384329467" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/116392521/c3193492d11a4a42a88d77c792b066d2/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=zkTd-EaLNXYNQpROLJW8XHvVsjTopremCkwjOFfGMmM%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-116392521">New Ambience: Tech Market</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-116392521" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Nov 20, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1cg:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1cg:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>As a longtime resident of New York CIty, I have an affinity for urban environments. They're not always the easiest places to live, but they do seem to offer occasional surprises that I feel like I wouldn't see in suburbia. Obviously, the country has it's own set of surprises!</p><p>Underground economies are interesting. Markets that emerge organically because there's a need, or because someone just has something to sell.  Sometimes they're the obvious ones, and sometimes it's just soup. Once I was jogging over the Manhattan bridge, from Brooklyn to Chinatown in Manhattan. Just before the end of the span, the footpath curves around before ending at Canal Street. It was here I saw about 10 elderly women, each with a small cook stove, stirring a pot, a small line of people waiting.</p><p><em>Tech Market</em>&nbsp;is a place like this. It started small; a couple of stands. Some sold scavanged bits from discarded machines, some sold repair services or modifications. Eventually it became known as a place to go for x, y or z. Other vendors popped up. Some relocated. It was out of the way, under a bridge, the city didn't care.</p><p>The ambience here is field recordings for China Town, some mine, some library sounds, layered with traffic (real and designed) and various tech noises and experiments.</p><p>Musically, this is mostly synths but much of the percussion is organic. I liked the combination. </p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peak mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I created a couple of 'No Rain' versions . The mixed version of this is pretty subtle. There's also an ambience-only version that has a lot of the heavier traffic as well as the rain removed leaving mostly a market. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p>P.S. I've basically decamped from Twitter so if you're on Bluesky, please come and find me: <a href="https://bsky.app/profile/tabletopaudio.bsky.social">https://bsky.app/profile/tabletopaudio.bsky.social </a></p><p>&nbsp;</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/115932282/ad05151c384c491fb7d66c6e1fafd8fd/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=S3DOkcckh0pfcHWw8wtptTKilcD65BcPJ5yj_4ci2bE%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 jHyYdF"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-map-115932282">New Ambience: Map Chamber</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-map-115932282" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Nov 13, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1cn:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1cn:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This track was entirely based around a violin recording I made a few weeks ago and revisited. It was kind of an anti-violin recording actually. Light bow strokes that only really hinted at the played note. Mostly wispy bow noise and organic sounding string vibrations. I had a heavy brass mute attached to the bridge to remove any of the body resonances and just focus on the strings and bow. It sounded cool. But, as I was near to completing the track there was always one thing that bothered me. It turns out, it was the violin. So, I removed it. I suppose it's like making a mold of something. You use an object to create an empty space, then you remove the object, and fill the space with something else. </p><p>Map Chamber is  a reverberant room with a pool of water at its center. Just beneath the water the outlines and shapes of the known world are revealed in great detail.  There is magic at play here. The map can change focus, shrink, enlarge and by augmented by real time information.</p><p>The ambience is built from subtle magical  textures, room tones and the gentle rippling of the water. There are people milling about. Let's call them Map Keepers. They are like the oracles of the map. </p><p>After using the violin as the focus as I described above, I added several tracks of bowed waterphone. I loved how this referenced the original violin while also underscoring the rippling of the central pool. This eventually became the central part of the sound. Additionally there are flautando strings, some bowed crotales,  mark tree and a marimba, hit gently with soft mallets. </p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here for download. Additionally, I created two 'No People' versions which creates an empty space with just the environmental elements.  I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=115932282&amp;m=378328606" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-jungle-115670663">SoundPad: Jungle Planet (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-jungle-115670663" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Nov 9, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1cu:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1cu:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released 14th Feb 2018, <em>Jungle Planet </em>became (unbeknownst to me at the time), the first of my series of 'planet' SoundPads. The original idea was simply to create a biome in which we could tell adventure stories, but that felt limiting. I almost never strive for actual realism! What fun is a jungle biome if I can't add alien sounding creatures, or birds that aren't from there, anachronistic human tribes, or...dinosaurs? So I added the word 'planet'  to signify it's footing in the fantasy realm, and to put off all those 'Akshooally' comments I sometimes get from people who are dismayed at my lack of verisimilitude. </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=115670663&amp;m=376582115" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Nov 6, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1d5:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1d5:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Goodhaven is a quiet, peaceful village on the banks of a river. It's a joyous and welcoming place. There's a lovely inn, bountiful game in the woods and  a decent ruined church with catacombs nearby in case you get bored. </p><p>The ambience, as you would expect is verdant meadow, sparkling water and busy folk everywhere.</p><p>Musically this is Celtic adjacent. There's live percussion, fiddle and acoustic guitar, backed by harp, chimes, small string section and cor anglais. It's upbeat and can get a little fun, but it's also peaceful.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I created two 'no people' versions which leaves us with more of a pure naturescape.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=115484467&amp;m=375358881" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-red-115016794">New Ambience: Red Sky Mine</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-red-115016794" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Oct 30, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1dc:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1dc:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>As much as I love the pew-pew laser battle aspects of sci-fi, I also love the grittier, hard, humans expanding their reach in a hostile universe side as well. Logistics, resource management, and problem solving may not sell a lot of toys, but they make stories of future humans, or even aliens, more relatable. </p><p>That's not to say that this track, <em>Red Sky Mine</em>, can't be the backdrop of some furious pew-pew laser battles. I like to think of it as a gritty set piece. Teams of miners, xenoarchaeologists, or treasure hunters, going about their chores on a hostile, barren planet. It would be at home in any number of sci-fi settings. It would also work just as well in more modern, terrestrial tales as there's not much in the way of advanced tech sounds.</p><p>Musically, this track revolves around treated guitar, and gutteral synth drones. There are some flautando strings serving as halos for the guitar notes, as well as the occasional rumble of an orchestral timpani.</p><p>The ambience features various large excavation machines, smaller support units, rocks and wind. There's really nothing here that would be out of place on earth in the current time. And no, diesel engines probably wouldn't run in a low oxygen atmosphere but I won't tell if you won't.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only and music-only version here. Additionally, I created 2 'No Machines' versions that feature the general ambience of the site but without the foreground vehicles.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=115016794&amp;m=372348504" class="cm-pQxmHn src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/114698493/77e48f6f5d9b4b6e9d057414cd9d6638/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=KgSsFP2AP7C7i6O8RKg7PtjwqQnU3-NfuG-ukxY_B0A%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-monster-114698493">SoundPad: Monster Pack (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-monster-114698493" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Oct 25, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1dj:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1dj:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released on January 26, 2018, Monster Pack represented a departure from the traditional SoundPad format in that it wasn't a set of sounds based around a particular environment, or  genre. Instead, it was essentially a set of foreground sounds designed to be used in conjunction with more traditional ambient effects.</p><p>Monster Pack is a collection of 18 monsters, each containing an idle sound as well as a number of attack sounds. These attack sounds were Multi-part sounds on the original online version, but they have been broken apart into individual sounds here for greater flexibility outside of the SoundPad engine.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=114698493&amp;m=370268117" class="cm-pQxmHn class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-114567470">New Ambience: Dungeon Asylum</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-114567470" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Oct 23, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1rc:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1rc:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This started out as a funny thought: What if you, the dungeon master, had a bestiary of creatures at your disposal that were simply too unhinged to function properly. They refused to adhere to their stat blocks. They moved when and where they wanted. Sometimes they just yelled things. Sometimes they sat on the floor and drew grotesque pictures with their claws. Sometimes they went totally berserk. You would probably not put any of these monsters in a normal dungeon, you'd stash them away somewhere dark until you could figure out what to do with them. And then, maybe you'd forgot about them..</p><p>The more I thought about this, the less amusing,  and scarier it got. So naturally, I had to make the music pretty frightening. Loads of aleatoric strings, clanging metal percussion, and various scraped and bowed objects around the studio. Then there's an <em>almost</em>&nbsp;action part where the track becomes more rhythmic  (more on that in a sec).</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'no inmate' versions which remove the monsters and leave you with an empty dungeon (where did they all go? that can't be good...) Finally, I liked the aforementioned drum section, so I isolated it into a short action-loop. There are 2 versions - .ogg and .mp3 which are identical so choose whichever works for you (.ogg loops better in general). I hope you find these useful.</p><p>As you may have guessed, this will end up being my Halloween track for 2024.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-114125319" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Oct 16, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1rj:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1rj:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>It's still fall here in New York City. In fact, most of our trees still have green leaves on them. But did that stop me from jumping head first into a winter themed ambience? No. No it did not.</p><p>I was trying out various microphones for violin recording so I figured I'd make that the basis of a new track. I wrote out a few simple melody ideas longhand before I decided to just riff on the basic theme. It took a few takes before I was ok with it, but I think it works for what it is. </p><p>I then did some orchestration with a small sampled string section and a smattering of voice. I like that the solo violin sounds rustic next to the pristine AIR Lyndhurst studio recording of the samples. Also, I used a convolution reverb impulse of the same AIR studios on the solo violin to place it in the same sonic space as the string ensemble.  I'll definitely be using this technique on other instruments in the future.</p><p>It's a quiet piece, well suited for a winter themed track. The ambience is from a wonderful field recording by Thomas Rex Beverly which I layered with various wind and branches track. That forms the bed. I then constructed the foreground elements out of many small parts, imagining the scene and populating it with various soldiers going about the business of maintaining a woodland campsite in winter.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here, for patrons. Additionally, I created two 'No Activity' versions which remove the soldiers entirely, leaving a wooded winterscape. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><h3><strong><u>Brief Website Note:</u></strong></h3><p>Several of you have emailed me about the massive drop-down list of SoundPads getting cut off on various browsers, screen sizes. I thought about trying to make a multi-tiered list and then decided maybe I'd just scrap the whole thing. A drop down list of 33 items is a bit silly and something I didn't consider when I started doing SoundPads 9 years ago. Also, as the site is entirely hand coded, every time I added a SoundPad, I had to update the menu on every single page, quite a pain!</p><p>So, I've removed the drop-down from the top level pages. The SoundPad link in the menu bar takes you to the SoundPad landing page, which I updated with all the header graphics, and added the genre filter from the homepage. I think this makes much more sense long term.</p><p>The drop-down lists remain on the lower level pages (and all SoundPads) but I'll be removing those as well in the coming days/weeks.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/113684049/5f25f98301ec42a5a39fdfb9e00b0356/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=KJnLDWQXTQDUoNISaY1sZhOxg6UmgD0HA2xKQ5fm1hY%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 dKLavz"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-113684049">New Ambience: The Undercroft</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-113684049" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Oct 9, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1rq:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1rq:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Unlike the word in its current usage, the original, medieval undercrofts, were subterranean. This is obviously the better and more correct way to describe a stone floored, vaulted ceilinged, dimly lit collection of rooms beneath a castle. I don't even want to discuss modern undercrofts as I think they have more in common with car ports and parking garages.</p><p>Now this one, is cool and dark, but lit by gently burning braziers. It's a forgotten room. Barrels full of who-knows-what are stacked in corners. Large objects are covered with tarpaulins, gray from decades of dust and rot. Rats and mice skitter about and collect in corners. In the distance, the walls whisper and pass on the sounds of the castle above. Amplified, distorted, reverberated.</p><p>Musically this is very subdued. Muted flautando string swells outlined by strummed harp create a pulsing, textured bed for woodwinds, brass, strings and voice. It's very atmospheric, so it would work well in a variety of situations. I think it would make a good downtime/resting track as well as pre/post battle track.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed-version, as well as ambience-only and music-only versions of the track at the bottom of this post. Additionally, I created 2 'with drips' versions which take the undercroft out of the safe, warm castle vibe into more of a dungeon. I hope you find these additions useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=113684049&amp;m=363727396" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 1.152C4.5 5.155 4.5 7.02 4.5 10.5v3c0 3.75 0 5.625.938 6.563C6.375 21 8.25 21 12 21c3.75 0 5.625 0 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>435_The_Undercroft.mp3</a></span><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=113684049&amp;m=363727457" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 1.152C4.5 5.155 4.5 7.02 4.5 10.5v3c0 3.75 0 5.625.938 6.563C6.375 21 8.25 21 12 21c3.75 0 5.625 0 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>435_The_Undercroft_With_Drips.mp3</a></span><span id="track-click"><a cm-GGZhvK"><div>And the question that inquiring players should hopefully ask ... "If the room's forgotten, who's been lighting and fuelling the braziers?"
Even smarter players will realise that whoever it is obviously has some kind of vision that requires, or is improved by, light.

(I didn't even know that 'undercroft' had been redefined, so thanks for that vocabulary update - come for the music, stay for dictionary corner!)</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1s1:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1s1:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released on Jan. 1st 2018, Here's what I wrote about Deep Six back then:</p><p></p><blockquote><p>This new SoundPad, <em>Deep Six</em>, has been brewing in the back of my mind for some time. I've always been a big fan of undersea films and I always find the environments and sounds are perfect for eliciting a feeling of adventure as well as dread.&nbsp;</p><p>Fathoms below the surface in a metal tube, blind except for arcane instruments and cryptic displays, crushing pressure all around and the darkness. There's just so much opportunity for story and adventure.</p><p>I wanted this to work for a variety of scenarios so I watched older films like <em>Das Boot</em>&nbsp;(one of my favorites) and newer ones like <em>Hunt for Red October</em>, <em>The Abyss</em>&nbsp;and <em>Crimson Tide</em>, and tried to combine elements from all of them.</p><p>Many sounds from Deep Six can also be used for space exploration. If you subtract the water, it's pretty similar. Try the groaning metal and background drone sounds for sci-fi horror settings.</p></blockquote><p></p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=113361178&amp;m=361656072" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-113226223">New Ambience: Cryo Pods</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-113226223" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Oct 2, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1s8:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1s8:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>As it's officially the spooky month, so I wanted to do a bit of sci-fi horror in the style of Event Horizon, Alien or Sunshine.  <em>Cryo Pods</em>&nbsp;has all the elements of classic sci-fi horror. Atonal, arhythmic, and aleatoric. All the A's! But really, at its heart, it's the dichotomy between the fear of not waking up vs the fear of waking into a world that's stranger and more dangerous than your recent dreams.</p><p>Musically this is a hybrid orchestral score combining synthesizers, organic drones, various metallic percussion and a sprinkle of clustered strings and woodwinds. Nobody did this better than Jerry Goldsmith on the original Alien film. </p><p>The ambience is built around a reverb impulse taken from the empty loading deck of a ferry. This provided a large, reverberant, and most importantly, metallic interior to place the sounds. Once I had that, I sent computer drones, beeps, fan and engine noise and other things that go clank or groan into it.  I then created some metallic impact sounds to act as droid feet and had them walk around the cryo chamber, you know, keeping an 'eye' on things. Or maybe someone reprogrammed them to wake you all up early so they could use you for an unspeakable experiment. hmm.</p><p>This track is currently in Patreon sneak-peek so I've included the mixed track (live on the site next week) as well as music-only and ambience-only versions. Additionally, if the above scenario about evil robots isn't to your taste, I've included a 'no-footsteps' version that removes the droids  from the equation. With them gone, I'm sure you and your crew will arrive at your destination healthy and refreshed! Or maybe...</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=113226223&amp;m=360838866" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-112761732">New Ambience: Spectral Abbey</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-112761732" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Sep 25, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1sf:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1sf:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This track started out as a Halloween piece, but soon morphed into something magical. As you all know, this happens to me a lot and I simply follow the prevailing winds to whatever destination it's taking me to.</p><p>I think there's a bit of a Harry Potter vibe in here, so when I was coming up with titles, I wanted something ghostly and haunted, but not quite scary. The spirits could be scary (they do sound a bit frightening) , but maybe they aren't. You'll have to decide.</p><p>The music here is all traditional orchestra. It's a fantasy adventure/action track with a heaping spoonful of magic.</p><p>The ambience is an old abbey, possibly in ruins, frequented by the spirits of the former denizens. What happened to them? Are they guarding something? Or maybe they're imprisoned there and looking for a way out. Keen listeners will note the use of the aptly named Aztec death whistle.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 "No Ghosts" variations which leaves just the abbey, the wind, and the waves. I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-true-112546502">SoundPad: True West (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-true-112546502" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Sep 22, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1sm:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1sm:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released on 17 May, 2017.  Here's a snippet from the original release post:</p><p></p><blockquote><p>"Like all my SoundPads before, this one (<em>True West</em>) is a noble failure. By which I mean, there's just no way that a few dozen sounds could ever do justice to a genre this broad. But as I created each of the sounds (I usually make almost double the number needed and whittle it down) I felt that I was getting closer to describing the idea. At least in broad outlines.</p><p>Distilling, in this case, 36 sounds to illustrate an era,&nbsp;is a bit like writing poetry. If a poem uses an economy of words&nbsp;to create a sensation or&nbsp;mood that is greater than the sum of it's parts. So too, a SoundPad, or any sound design really, attempts to tap into an established audio vocabulary that excites the brain into experiencing or remembering a place or action. In True West I've taken the basic ideas of outside life and inside life (in this case, the saloon) and combined them so that they would make a fitting backdrop to adventure.</p><p>You could create&nbsp;entire scenes using just the night wind with crickets around a campfire. Or craft an episode using the slow stagecoach and theme music. Or, if you're feeling spicy, try robbing a train or playing a hand of cards."</p></blockquote><p></p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=112546502&amp;m=356495613" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.375V4.503c0-.743-.006-1.12-.197-1.31-.192-.19-.569-.195-1.311-.19-2.996.018-4.494.152-5.243 cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-112305333" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Sep 18, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1st:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1st:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: Oops! I forgot to add id3 tag info to the files. I've fixed that and re-uploaded them!</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Before anyone asks, yes, I do love the Ken Russel film "Lair of the White Worm". It's one of my favorite campy, low budget comedy/horror films!</p><p>This is not that. This wyrm isn't campy, it's lying in wait for a group of deeply silly adventurers who are going to regret many of their life choices if they enter its domain. Coiled in the center of a large chamber, this massive wingless dragon is protecting something valuable. A pile of gold? A clutch of eggs? A soufflé recipe?</p><p>The music here is full-on ominous. It's dangerous. Lots of heavily effected orchestral instruments blended with synthesizers to create a hybrid, tension-filled underscore. I think it would work equally well in sci-fi and horror scenarios.</p><p>The ambience is cavernous wind, rock fall and of course, the wyrm. Coiling and uncoiling it's massive body it groans, hisses, slithers and encircles.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here, for patrons. Additionally, I've created two 'No Wyrm' versions which remove the beastie and leave you with an empty (?) cavern.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-111865462" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Sep 11, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1t4:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1t4:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Something happens to my brain when I hear a few notes played on the vibraphone. It goes straight back in time and I start seeing everything in black and white.</p><p>To that end, I embraced this vibe (oof, terrible unintended pun) and created a classic hotel lobby in the film noir tradition. It's in some city in the early 20th century. It doesn't really matter where, as long as it's in black and white. People mill about. Some are relaxed and reading newspapers, some are drinking, most are watching. One man in particular seems very interested in another man's briefcase...</p><p>The music here is cinematic underscore. A bit of John Barry, a bit of Goldsmith and a bit of me  just chucking things in because it sounded cool. </p><p>The ambience is a medium sized crowd in a hotel lobby. Sounds from the city outside filter in. Elevator doors open and close, the front desk checks people in and out. A couple of people pace in the foreground.</p><p>As this is in sneak-peek mode, I've attached the <em>mixed version</em>&nbsp;(live on the site next week), as well as <em>music-only, and ambience-only versions</em>&nbsp;here for patrons. Additionally, I created 2 'After Hours' versions, which remove most of the crowd walla (unintelligible background vocals in sound-design speak) and replace it with room-tone. </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-combat-111548846" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Sep 6, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1tb:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1tb:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/file size considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>--</p><p>Originally released in January of 2017, Combat:Future was the follow-up to to the original Combat SoundPad. While the original focused on medieval/fantasy fighting, Combat:Future takes the same basic concept and moves it into more modern/sci-fi territory. </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-111415214">New Ambience: Fire Dance</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-111415214" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Sep 4, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1ti:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1ti:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>The first hints of autumn are descending on New York City and I do love a bonfire in the cool evenings (not in the city, of course). Which is to say, I was thinking about fires when I created this tribal/pagan/ritual track of a group of revelers around a large fire pit. I was probably also remembering the great <em>Killing Joke</em>&nbsp;video for their song <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GUQhNEyAf0I">Let's All Go (to the Fire Dances)</a></p><p>There could be many reasons for this dance. A drug-fueled vision quest, a funeral, a pre-battle spirit summoning, or any number of other things people get up to the woods. It could certainly be viking themed, but it doesn't have to be.</p><p>I played lots of acoustic instruments (drums, percussion, tagelharpa, viola, voice) for this, as it felt appropriate, but I also didn't shy from adding modern sound-design elements to push it further. It ended up in a psychedelic place pretty quickly. There's also definitely a nightmare/horror vibe to this. </p><p>The ambience has the fire of course, plus some various torch whooshes and bone charms, as well as a forest/jungle ambience.  Technically I could have put the chanting into the ambience but I thought it made more sense to keep it with the music. </p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've attached the mixed-version, as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions of the track. Additionally, I created 2 'no wildlife' versions which remove some of the distant bird/animal sounds which could make this track work in non arboreal environments or even indoors.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=111415214&amp;m=349216348" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="sc-6938f163-10 kDLTBP"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK"><time datetime="2024-09-04T18:03:37.832Z" cm-GGZhvK"><div>Excellent new track, Tim!  Thank you!

I have a playlist called "fire pit" that I use in the spring and fall when I'm sitting by the fire pit and daydreaming (ev'n-dreaming?) fantastic things.  Some tracks are of course fire-related (e.g., Blacksmith Shoppe, Forge of Fury) but far from all.  Among the best for fire pit dreaming are the Orrery, Desert Temple, Viking Village, Moisture Farm... and now Fire Dance!

Thank you for sharing this splendid enterprise of yours.  No question, it enhances D&amp;D games.  But ever since I was introduced to TabletopAudio a few years ago by friends, it's been part of the background of much of my life.  

I wish you and everyone much happy fire pit ev'n-dreaming.

--Floyd</div></p></div></div><div data-tag="comment-actions" class="sc-6938f163-9 imwKue"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 BsKbD"><div class="sc-6938f163-8 fBebWH"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-110954951">New Ambience: Imperial Pursuit</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-110954951" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Aug 28, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r1tp:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r1tp:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: Fixed the double 'no troopers' file and replaced one with Amb-only no troopers.</em>&nbsp;</p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>This is one of those tracks that I've had in the works for a few months. I liked it originally, and then I didn't. I'd let it be for a week, then listen to it again, change things, add things, delete things - repeat.</p><p>Last week I opened it again and was finally able to zero in on what was making it not work for me. I removed a bunch of instruments and then moved some lines around to different orchestral sections until it finally seemed like something I could go to tweak-town on.</p><p>I started this as a John Williams-esque track but it gradually morphed out of being pure pastiche and developed more of its own personality. The vibe is definitely action/chase oriented but as with a lot of these types of track, I do like to ebb the intensity a bit, even if just to bring it back.</p><p>I set the ambience in the <em>Not Deathstar™ </em>with the point of view of a person, or persons escaping from legions of <em>Not Stormtroopers™</em>. It's a bit of a hide and seek, with periods of calm as you hide around corners, punctuated by full-on sprints down the corridors. Distant shouts, gunfire, droids and various computer sounds let you know that you're just out of reach.</p><p>The music is purely orchestral (no synths were tortured during the making of this piece), so it should make a fine action/chase set piece across a variety of genres.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode (live on the site next week), I've included the mixed version, as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions of this track here. Additionally, I included 2 'no-trooper' versions that remove the marching, comms and gunfire. The distant shouting remains. You are still being hunted, they're just further away!</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=110954951&amp;m=346331833" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/110530707/daf5a9a306254bf2a93bf6b1ece2a204/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=dDyw0oILUlVGA91kOLAcni0KY46GgviXsAfD46rFvrI%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"
