class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/filesize considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>Additionally, the files have all been renamed with a more consistent naming convention and id3 tags have been added.</p><p>---</p><p><em>The Tavern</em>&nbsp;was originally released on February 3, 2016. It was designed to simulate as many different taverns as I could in a minimal number of sounds.</p><p>Cozy, busy, raucous, edgy. The Tavern could be all these things. From empty late-night stopovers (try <em>fireplace, cups and plates,</em>&nbsp;and <em>snoring patron</em>) to boisterous weekend parties. (<em>medium crowd, chugging contest, laughter, table flip)</em></p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/tavern_sp.html">https://tabletopaudio.com/tavern_sp.html</a>&nbsp;</p><p></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-103872711">New Ambience: Jungle Bunker</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-103872711" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 8, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2fp:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2fp:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I've been working on this track for a few weeks. It's fairly complex so it was something that I kept going back to, making changes, tweaking things, etc.  My original plan was to have it done by May 4th (Star Wars Day) but sadly, that did not come on a Wednesday. (who do I speak to about this!)</p><p><em>Jungle Bunker</em>&nbsp;is <em>totally</em>&nbsp;not based on Endor, stormtroopers, or AT-ST walkers, it just isn't, so let's move along, this isn't the pastiche you're looking for!</p><p>Musically, this is a full orchestra (and then some) working in a Williams-esque mode and attempting to deliver an adventure/space-fantasy vibe.  By itself, it should work across a variety of adventure genres. There is a bit of an ebb and flow here but it's fairly consistent in tone.</p><p>The ambience is jungle sounds, a low-tech hum, and 'not-stormtroopers' talking over comms. There's also some kind of mech sentry thing stomping about on patrol. You and your party are probably hiding behind bushes figuring out a plan to get inside. Maybe the local teddy bears can help? Rebel scum!</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I've created 2 'no trooper' versions in the hopes that you eventually dispatch the guards (somehow), or just need an abandoned jungle outpost that still seems to be running. I hope you find these additions useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=103872711&amp;m=305246614" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-combat-103559507">SoundPad: Combat (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-combat-103559507" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 3, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2g0:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2g0:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/filesize considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>------</p><p>Originally released on 30 November 2015, Combat was designed as a medieval battle simulator. It contained building blocks for various types of battles, from large-scale conflicts to small skirmishes.  Multiple weapon attacks are included, as well as magic spells.  Additionally, the 8 trap sounds included were subsequently added to the original Dungeon SoundPad.</p><p>Combat made heavy use of the x2, x3, x4 type sounds originally introduced in <em>Starship </em>for creating variety out of common actions, e.g. sword hits. In the online SoundPad engine, a x4 sound would play 1 of 4 available sounds every time the action was triggered. </p><p>For this downloadable version, each of the x2 etc sounds are divided into individual sounds, hence 53 sounds instead of the original 38.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/combat_sp.html">https://tabletopaudio.com/combat_sp.html</a>&nbsp;</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=103559507&amp;m=303436575" class="cm-pQxmHn 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-103417935">New Ambience: Stakeout</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-103417935" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>May 1, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2g7:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2g7:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Here's an urban noire, surveillance, cyberpunk, underscore mashup. In my constant quest for liminal spaces and environments, I've always enjoyed a good stakeout. Stakeouts are a lot like fishing in that the activity is a pretense for the real purpose: A proper get-to-know-you hang.</p><p>Yes, the plot device is to show the audience what the bad guys are up to, but stakeouts are also about the character development of the watchers. Who are they, and why are they here? </p><p>In this ambience, 2 characters are in a city apartment on a high floor. They snap photos, read newspapers, type notes on a laptop, and assemble something on a table (sniper rifle? MacGuffin?) They could also be cracking a safe, it's unclear.</p><p>Musically this is cyberpunk and synth-wave adjacent. It would work in a fairly wide variety of modern or sci-fi scenes as underscore.  Here, synths are sprinkled with orchestral instruments. Tremolo strings and marimba to be specific.</p><p>As this track is in sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions here for patrons. Additionally, I removed the outside cityscape and created 2 'Quiet Versions' that are just the interior activities and room tones. </p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=103417935&amp;m=302707740" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-102970505">New Ambience: Collegium Magica</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-102970505" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Apr 24, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2ge:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2ge:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Here is a fairly quiet, meditative track featuring a large reverberant space, populated by mages and other students of the magical arts, deep in research.</p><p>The ambience was the first thing I began with. I combined recordings of library reading rooms, room tones of empty halls, braziers for heat, and walla (sound design speak for undiscernible background speech). I also played in some crystal wind chimes by building a sampler instrument and recording it over the background.</p><p>Musically this relies heavily on drones built from orchestral instruments and processed. Layered on top of that, there is sparse deep percussion, odd choral dissonances, a harp, and some live-tracked violin and ney flute.</p><p>As this track is currently in sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here, for patrons. Additionally, I created 2 '<em>Empty</em>' versions which cut down a lot of the human element leaving more of the space. It's subtle, but I liked the effect, especially in the ambience-only version. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=102970505&amp;m=300364664" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-olde-102834086">SoundPad: Olde Towne (Remastered)</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/soundpad-olde-102834086" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Apr 22, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2gl:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2gl:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em>&nbsp;than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/filesize considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website), they will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>------</p><p>Originally released on October 23rd, 2015, Old Towne was designed as a medieval city/village simulation. I designed it with the idea that you could stack elements to create larger, bustling environments, or leave space for smaller places.</p><p>Olde Towne has elements for markets, town squares, desolate alleys, and docks. There's even a dragon. I laughed when I re-read this paragraph from the original post:</p><blockquote><p><em>And yes, I threw in a dragon because..well, dragons. Don't want to fight dragons in town? Make her the town mascot. Call her Joan.</em></p></blockquote><p>Olde Towne contains 36 sounds, including 3 music tracks.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com/olde_towne_sp.html">https://tabletopaudio.com/olde_towne_sp.html</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/102533880/15af20e9718c4da7a9b32516aed08984/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=Jrqg1avwLB-3978hNX4SY88WUlvADqdqPnMAw6oeoqk%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambiences-102533880">New Ambiences: Tomb Guardians</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambiences-102533880" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Apr 17, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2gs:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2gs:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I've always loved the film <em>Jason &amp; The Argonauts (1963). </em>My favorite scene was when Hercules and his companion encountered the giant statue of the titan, Talos. When the statue turned his head for the first time, well, let's say it was a pretty powerful moment for 10-year-old me.</p><p>If you need a refresher: <a href="https://youtu.be/SNg4KZKG96o?si=DNzlVVjsBJXncDLj&amp;t=175">https://youtu.be/SNg4KZKG96o?si=DNzlVVjsBJXncDLj&amp;t=175</a></p><p>As if Ray Harryhausen's stop-motion animation wasn't enough, Bernard Herrmann's score sealed the deal, especially his use of ultra-low woodwinds like the contrabass clarinet.</p><p>I took this basic concept, created two stone/metal automata, and placed them in a crypt as guardians, standing still for eternity until disturbed.</p><p>Musically this is more of a Herrmann vis a vis John Williams mashup. I used heaps of atonality with very little melodic relief. I borrowed (<em>stole</em>) some orchestration from Herrmann and used lots of low woodwinds and low brass. </p><p>This is a very high-tension track that could be used as action, suspense, or even horror.</p><p>The ambience is modulated wind, creaking metal, scraping stone and vocalizations from throats made of metal and stone.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only and music-only versions. Additionally, I created two 'No Guardians" versions for more of a standard crypt-like feel.  I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=102533880&amp;m=298081754" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-102090601">New Ambience: Ship of the Line</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-102090601" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Apr 10, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2h3:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2h3:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Or should I say, Ahoy! This week's ambience takes us to sea in a fast, sturdy ship. This is one of those tracks where the music decided what the eventual ambience was going to be. A few days into it I began thinking it sounded vaguely militaristic, and more specifically, naval. I can't actually describe what that means musically, perhaps it was because the earliest versions were all extremely drum-centric.</p><p>As I  added more instruments, the drums in their original state, made less sense. It was way too busy. Remembering the lesson that I re-learn <em>every single day</em>, if you want to make a thing better, take something away. Once the drums were removed I could finally hear the orchestration (or lack thereof) and start fixing it. I then added a sparser rhythm track that didn't overwhelm the music as much.</p><p>The ambience is wind, waves, rope, cloth and wood -  just as Lord Nelson commanded.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as ambience-only and music-only versions of the track here, for patrons. Additionally, I created a mixed and ambience 'storm' version. Not really a full-on storm, consider it more of a heavy seas and a bit of weather variation.</p><p>The music track on it's own will work across a variety of genres as an action or adventuring background.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=102090601&amp;m=295763962" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 6.563-.937.937-.938.937-2.813.937-6.563V12c0-.74-.005-1.115-.195-1.305-.19-.19-.565-.195-1.305-.195"></path></svg></span>411_Ship_of_the_Line.mp3</a></span><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=102090601&amp;m=295764001" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" They initially take place in the fishing village of Saltmarsh and its environs, but will eventually take the characters across wide seas to strange and dangerous lands.  This track will definitely have its moment (or several), along with High Seas Pursuit and a continuing favorite: Pirates!  
Tim, I don't know who you are or anything about you, but I'm always impressed by your talent and creativity, and grateful to you for sharing these tracks widely. data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 egnxkP"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-101642861">New Ambience: Forgotten Forest</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-101642861" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Apr 3, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2sq:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2sq:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>One of my absolute favorite ways to begin working on a track is by simply playing around with combinations of instruments. In this case, I was using several orchestral tuned percussion instruments where I might normally choose a piano. Celeste, Glockenspiel and Vibraphone have such unique tones, metallic and pure. I did end up putting a piano back, but played softly, so it mellows out the metals.</p><p>This was originally called 'Necrotic Woods' until I wrote the 'B' section and realized it was too magical sounding and not nearly grim enough for necrosis. I think it still maintains some darkness,  a hint of danger, and a bit of foreboding, so the title got changed to 'Forgotten Forest' and voila! I liked it better. </p><p>The ambience is synthetic winds mixed with field recordings and processed a bit to sound vaguely unnatural. I combined this with creaking tree limbs, rustling leaves, and ghostly whispers. </p><p>As this is in sneak-peek mode for patrons, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions. Additionally, I added 2 'No Whispers' versions (much more apparent in the ambience-only version) to make it slightly less <em>super</em> and more <em>natural</em>.</p><p>The music-only track will work nicely for magical environments. It's dramatic, tense, and cinematic without being too epic.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=101642861&amp;m=293402560" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-101180077">New Ambience: Docking Procedure</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-101180077" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Mar 27, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2t1:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2t1:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>The working title for this ambience was 'big things moving slowly'. I was going for a feeling of weight and inertia. I knew it was going to be sci-fi, but like all my favorite sci-fi music, it didn't have to be.</p><p>The ambience for this is a bunch of sounds, metallic and otherwise, stretched, pitched and reverberated to sound large. </p><p>The massive central ship is old and cranky. It doesn't like to be pushed. It groans and creaks its dissent at every turn. It's a good thing the pilot of the ship is a stubborn old freighter jock, so he's having none of it. </p><p>The music mirrors the action. Lots of low-end synths and strings float in and out. The music builds and ebbs as the great ship goes through its paces. There is a treated felt piano that keeps things from going too epic, but not quite folksy. As I mentioned above, the music will work nicely with all manner of big things moving slowly, regardless of genre. </p><p>As this is in sneak-peek mode for patrons, I've included the mixed track (live on the site next week), as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions.  Additionally, I created 2 versions that remove the docking ship, but keep the smaller vessels that fly around it. It should be useful for a more generic exterior spaceport.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=101180077&amp;m=291007860" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/samurai-hq-2014-100861711" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Mar 22, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2t8:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2t8:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>As many of you know, I didn't always create bonus tracks for ambiences. That came about organically when a few people asked for small changes (no rain, no footsteps) and I thought that if I planned the projects better from the start I could offer these types of variations.</p><p>I recently had a request for a music-only track from 2014. Revisiting these old tracks is often something of a minefield. 2014 was 3 computers, 2 operating systems, and who knows how many DAW versions ago. Often there's a fair bit of forensics involved, including re-installing old plugins, re-locating samples, etc.</p><p>For this track I (mostly) had everything where it needed to be so I've created music-only, and ambience-only versions.</p><p>Cheers!</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a></p><p></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Mar 20, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2tf:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2tf:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Like many of you, I've been playing Baldur's Gate 3. The problem I have with video games (aside from being quite bad at most of them) is that a) I don't have much time to play and b) I only play an hour, max, before either 1) the guilt sets in, or 2) something in the game inspires me to work on sound or music.</p><p>This track is my take on the first scene in which the player has to escape from a crashing Nautiloid (interdimensional mind flayer ship. The ship itself is a living entity, complete with sinewy structures, moist, glistening walls, and electro-organic control consoles.</p><p>In this scenario, the mind flayers (illithids) are dead or dying as the heroes are trying to navigate the unfamiliar maze of chambers and corridors. Consoles are fritzing out and many of the walls seem to be... bleeding? That can't be right.</p><p>The music is chase/action/suspense but has some ebb and flow in it as well. It is primarily orchestral but there are a few synths and treated orchestral instruments to help give it an otherworldly flair. The music-only track would make a good cross-genre action/escape piece.</p><p>The ambience is a mix of tech and organic. &nbsp;Metallic clangs and wet gurgles combine with sparks and general electrical malfunction. The mind flayers, whose bodies litter the ship are either dead, wailing in pain, or desperately trying to get inside your brain. Fun!</p><p>As this track is in Patreon-exclusive sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed-version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'No Mind Flayer' versions which remove the screams and vocalizations and just leave the ship. I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=100737003&amp;m=288743922" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2tm:">Show class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm continuing to remaster these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em> than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/filesize considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website) will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>------</p><p>Originally released on 8 August 2015, <strong>Starship</strong> was the 3rd of the SoundPad series. It contains &nbsp;32 sounds including 6 layerable tones and 3 musical tracks. Starship also contained the first multi-part sounds.&nbsp;</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/100301438/c9aedfc77e5c4ea89e96621537b899f9/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=6CiKo_YvytWahVdUFUt3LQtm_MdyPDuPbDaWYoOkVwI%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-100301438">New Ambience: Viking Tavern</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-100301438" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Mar 13, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2tt:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2tt:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>What's better than a cup of strong ale, and a warm fire after a hard day of pillaging villages? I suppose you could be a community of pacifist Vikings who just built a school for children, but, I wonder, &nbsp;would the thirst be as fierce? Alas, these are existential questions that I don't have the answers to I'm afraid.</p><p>Because I'm still enamored with my new custom, handmade tagelharpa (see below!) I've been looking for reasons to use it. It's got horsehair strings and is played with a horsehair bow so it sounds scratchy and rough, a bit like Vikings, so I'm told.</p><p><img data-media-id="286531689" src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/100301438/b03552059db94091a2db5c619c097ca6/eyJ3ZWJwIjowfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=s9j4BpzpG3joyuMo2RoFIzGhz1ANw2pwciGkqOyKTPU%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200"></p><p>As rule #12 of tabletop gaming states that you can never have enough taverns, I thought this was an excellent way of killing a few birds. That came out wrong, but I think you get the picture.</p><p>I'll start by admitting that the music for Viking Tavern is not authentic at all. It has elements of authenticity (see above), live percussion, jaw harp, and even an attempt at gruff singing. I liked the sound of the oboe and Irish flute against the large drums. And then, I had to add a violin part because it sounded sad and jaunty at the same time.&nbsp;</p><p>The ambience is a fairly standard tavern background - drinking, talking, merriment. It really doesn't have to be Vikings.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created an empty tavern ambience, which is simply the fireplace and some wind/outside noises. Finally, while working on the mixing for this, I found myself listening to the percussion alone quite a bit and I thought they could stand up nicely by themselves, so I added a Music only - Drums version which removes everything but the drums, shakers, and bells.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,&nbsp;</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=100301438&amp;m=286536500" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-99865595">New Ambience: Treacherous Path</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-99865595" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Mar 6, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2u4:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2u4:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Sometimes there's a reason that it is the road less traveled.</p><p>I was dreaming up this scenario where a party has a long distance to cover, and one member (we all know it was the bard) pipes up and tells everyone he knows a shortcut. This is the first part of a tale in which there's good news and bad news. The good news is that it will cut days off their journey. The bad news is they might all die.</p><p><em>Treacherous Path</em> is that moment when you think long and hard about your priorities, and whether arriving late is preferable to arriving in pieces.</p><p>The ambience here is dark and foreboding. Eerie winds, strange atmospheric events, lava pits, and winged demons. A bit like my last trip to a big box store.</p><p>Musically this is just as dark. Heavy low strings, tortured synths, and fractured vocals. There's a bit of a progression to the piece, I was trying to make it feel like phases of a journey. The ending almost feels like you might make it.</p><p>This track would work well to introduce a dangerous setting in fantasy, horror, or even scifi.</p><p>As this track is in Patreon-only sneak peek mode, I've included the mixed version, as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created two 'no creature' versions that make it more barren and desolate. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=99865595&amp;m=284283273" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-99388174">New Ambience: Brood Mother</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-99388174" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Feb 28, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2ub:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2ub:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Here's a sci-fi track, masquerading as a fantasy track, masquerading as a horror track. Wheels within wheels!</p><p>Brood Mother began its life as a sustained action sequence that would have been at home in a Mad Max film. As the work progressed though, various elements &nbsp;(I'm not really sure which) started to lend themselves to a more claustrophobic escape-styled action sequence.</p><p>The Brood Mother herself came as I was playing around with some vocal processing on some tongue clacks which made a horrible, chitinous sound. &nbsp;Then it was off to the races. &nbsp;Teeming hordes of hatchlings, a humid hatchery, and ooze-covered walls, they're all here.</p><p>As I mentioned, this is sci-fi, fantasy, and horror. It can be one of the above, or any combination of the three. As long as something is chasing you, threatening you, or just standing in your way, this should work.</p><p>Musically, this track features lots of drums and synths. Strings and vocals play a supporting role. I added a bit of scratchy, organic tagelharpa &nbsp;to make it a bit more visceral</p><p>As this is in Patreon-only sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week), in addition to ambience-only, and music-only versions. I also added 2 'no mother' versions in case she happens to be somewhere else (nothing to worry about, I'm sure?). I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=99388174&amp;m=281894961" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci these early SoundPads, and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these re-mastered audio files are of <em>higher quality</em> than what appears online (bandwidth/cost issues) and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/filesize considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website) will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>------</p><p>Originally released on 26 June 2015, <strong>Dark Forest</strong> was the 2nd of the SoundPad series. It contains &nbsp;32 sounds including 4 layerable tones and 3 musical tracks.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/98937172/3d46b2d906e14fd6919d1989e243376f/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=0GR3HvzQP8NUu7MuSD3YFOVpo9Vil8IddFRnWRjjEmU%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-98937172">New Ambience: Vampyr</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-98937172" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Feb 21, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2up:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2up:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I sat down this week to write a piece in 5/4, mostly as a challenge. For non-musicians, that means there are 5 beats in a measure (quarter note getting 1 beat). It's not too far out, but considering that 90% of music is written in 4/4 it does have a bit of an unsettling vibe to it.&nbsp;</p><p>As I continued to write, I found that the music had an elegant quality to it. Hmm..elegance, unsettling...what could this be?</p><p>Piano, harp, celeste, and chamber orchestra all work together, and often against each other. Dissonance adds to the unease.&nbsp;</p><p>Musically, this is about revelation. It's about walking into an opulent room and seeing a vampire lying in 'state'. The dawning of awareness, the slow raising of the eyebrows, &nbsp;a barely audible "ohh, sh*t".</p><p>The ambience is extremely understated as it's an empty room except for some distant floorboard creaks of the vampire's attendants. Wind and wolves howl outside. A fire is lit, but it's for the living. An old grandfather clock beats out the millennia, one tick at a time.</p><p>As this is in Patreon-exclusive sneak peak mode, I've included the mixed-version (live on the site next week) as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 alternate ambiences, one without the clock (even though it's very quiet) and one has a light rain outside and a bit more thunder. I hope you find these useful.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=98937172&amp;m=279587910" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Feb 14, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2v0:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2v0:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Steel Foundry is a large reverberant chamber where blast furnaces, chain hoists, and strong arms all work to create raw material.</p><p>It's vaguely dwarven, by which I mean there are certainly echoes of Moria, but there's a slightly more sinister vibe at work.</p><p>Musically, this is piano, voice, and some live percussion courtesy of my new 'horror box', an amplified, acoustic percussion instrument for all manner of bowed, and struck sounds. &nbsp;There are also some synths and treated strings.</p><p>As this is in Patreon sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as music-only, and ambience-only versions here. Additionally, I created 2 'no worker' versions, which means less activity in that they don't feature as much of the bangs and klangs.&nbsp;</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2vl:">Show class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit#2: It was brought to my attention that I can't count. There were 2 missing sounds from the original upload - blade trap and net trap. These have been located and added to the .zip/.rar files. There should be 36 sounds plus 1 image in the archive.</em></p><p><em>Edit: Sorry Mac users! I forgot that .rar isn't the best format for you. I've added an identical .zip file. &nbsp;If everyone is ok with that I'll use that format going forward. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>I'm finally getting around to remastering these early SoundPads and making them available as Patreon exclusive downloads.&nbsp;</p><p>Please don't share these files. <em>They are for you, dear patrons, and you alone!</em></p><p>The website versions will most likely stay as they are for the time being, but these new audio files are of higher quality and have been tweaked to the standards of the later SoundPads.</p><p>The format for these will be .ogg as it's superior to mp3 for looping purposes as well as quality/filesize considerations.</p><p>As with most Patreon content, the simplest way to access it is via the Tabletop Audio website. As each SoundPad is remastered, a "Download on Patreon" button will appear on the page. That link will take you to the appropriate post.</p><p>If there are any Multi-part sounds (denoted by the x2, x4, etc on the website) will be split into individual sounds as they would require the SoundPad engine to play properly. e.g.</p><p>------</p><p>Originally released on 22 May 2015, <strong>The Dungeon SoundPad </strong>was the first of the SoundPad series. It launched with 28 sounds but was updated a few months later with 8 trap sounds for a total of 36.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><br></p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-98035227" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Feb 7, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r2vs:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r2vs:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p><em>Edit: I updated the 3 tracks with music in them (neither of the AMB tracks) as I found some weird issues after listening to it a couple of days later. You can find the new tracks below. The date should be 12 Feb, 2024. - Tim</em></p><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>The music was completed on this one before I knew what it was going to be. I'm sure you'll agree that it could have gone in many directions. There's a wistful, nostalgic quality here so I was thinking of a return to something. But I just recently made a track called <em>Homecoming</em>. The entire time I was writing this, I was thinking of large objects moving in slow motion. So, underwater it was, and naturally, whales became those objects.</p><p>Musically this is lilting and swirling and, as I mentioned, quite nostalgic. Strings and woodwinds do the heavy lifting with a dash of brass and percussion. I don't often add piano to orchestral pieces (I don't know why, and I think I'll probably do this more) so I did some rearranging of the sketching piano part and it fit nicely.&nbsp;</p><p>I think this will make a good expository, start-of-adventure-type piece. It would also be good for breaks in the action as a bit of relief.</p><p>The ambience is water, bubbles, whooshes, occasional tower doors, and whalesong. I searched for natural recordings of whales for way too long before I decided to play them on a synthesizer. &nbsp;In the mix, I think they work well.</p><p>This is in Patreon sneak-peek mode so I've included the mixed version (live on the site next week) as well as ambience-only, and music-only versions. Additionally, I created 2 'No Whales' versions which are subtly different but I hope may make it a bit more flexible for different stories/scenarios.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a joDoFb"><div class="sc-622cce91-1 gemWzX"><div><div class="cm-wtUehf cm-MCtAYf cm-biFicN" data-tag="comment-send-avatar-root"><img data-tag="comment-send-avatar" class="cm-baquNM" src="https://c8.patreon.com/4/120/61099/L" alt=""></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-622cce91-2 jCznAO"><div class="sc-840d7053-3 cvUsBW"><div data-tag="comment-field-box" class="sc-840d7053-0 mtdDS"><div data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false" aria-label="Comment Field" aria-multiline="true" data-tag="comment-field" id="comment-section-input" placeholder="Join the conversation..." rows="1" class="sc-840d7053-5 jkahMQ"></textarea></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div><div data-tag="post-card"><div class="sc-ef8b06c8-0"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 dbVxfk"><div class="cm-iFCzpr cm-biDAuW cm-SXSTSm cm-DAbLap"><div class="sc-4221c731-0"><div class="sc-4221c731-1 hlTBMb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-4 iftDkb"><div class="sc-a7ca7965-8 cdEFwZ"><div class="gallery-grid-item"><div class="sc-507b496e-0 iCQuhJ image-grid"><img src="https://c10.patreonusercontent.com/4/patreon-media/p/post/97569005/7c8b52f134bc4cd5996c1e8939a4fe02/eyJ3IjoxMDgwfQ%3D%3D/1.jpg?token-hash=5Mglzej-OPI7aqlgczld2AkrxVOUdjSqFGZ1RcMgXpE%3D&amp;token-time=1757203200" loading="lazy" class="sc-507b496e-2 htRBuC"></div></div></div><div class="sc-a7ca7965-3 gHhHrs"></div></div></div><div class="cm-lPflDU"><div class="sc-39651d8c-2 hdHuoy"><div><div><div class="cm-imXdeh"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div><span class="cm-ialtoT cm-dyHRMA cm-KbsWTM cm-boAtIs cm-iPaVSC cm-ThmtRO cm-GGZhvK cm-bBDjcV cm-bjIYXb" data-tag="post-title"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-97569005">New Ambience: Feast of Crispian</a></span></div></div></div><div class="sc-209d42cd-0 dPQwHY"><div class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU cm-vMqrUI cm-GGZhvK sc-209d42cd-2 kyefAc"><div class="sc-209d42cd-1 heKzHR"><div class="sc-c3051d5d-0 hJbUuK"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button"><div class="cm-nbFCfZ cm-HvgpSm cm-wfkYWE" data-tag="chip-container"><span class="cm-VzrHRj cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-wWrYzV cm-zZoZpN cm-GGZhvK">New</span></div></button></div><span id="track-click"><a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/new-ambience-of-97569005" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-StyNxk cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-isJlgp cm-dupTbP cm-NAbYEF cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-published-at"><span><span>Jan 31, 2024</span></span></a></span></div></div></div></div><div class="cm-gBCCZY"><div class="sc-6b0897ec-0 hnhBGU"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 iAojJp"><button class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" type="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls=":r303:">Show more</button></div><div class="sc-827a7d51-0 cJqAbW"><div aria-hidden="false" class="sc-827a7d51-1 gMgVGi"><div id=":r303:"><div aria-hidden="true"><div class="sc-9628564b-0 copkPe"><div class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p><br></p><p>This track started with a jaunty rhythmic melody shared between a mountain dulcimer and a harp. It was giving me tavern music vibes from the start. However, as I added various sections and instruments, it seemed somehow more 'important' than a simple tavern band bashing out the hits. Was it a wedding feast? I went down that path for a bit but there was something not quite about it.</p><p><br></p><p>Then I remembered the famous speech from Henry V, where Henry addresses his soldiers about the impending Battle of Agincourt. The English army is outnumbered and the soldiers are frightened. Henry assures them, saying he is personally happy that there aren't more English soldiers because there will be more glory to go around! He then announces a feast for St. Crispin's Day which would become a yearly event:</p><p><br></p><blockquote>"This day is called the feast of Crispian:<br>He that outlives this day, and comes safe home,<br>Will stand a tip-toe when the day is named,<br>And rouse him at the name of Crispian.<br>He that shall live this day, and see old age,<br>Will yearly on the vigil feast his neighbours,<br>And say ‘To-morrow is Saint Crispian:’<br>Then will he strip his sleeve and show his scars.<br>And say ‘These wounds I had on Crispin’s day."</blockquote><blockquote>-From <em>Henry V</em>, Act IV, Scene III</blockquote><p><br></p><p>And so, &nbsp;here is a scene is a tavern, or a great hall, featuring soldiers and families making merry on the eve of battle. Of course, you can ignore all of the above and treat it like a tavern track if you like!</p><p><br></p><p>Musically this is held down by the staples of of tavern music. Strings, flutes, and drums. It's a larger ensemble than you might normally find, but I felt that added the necessary weight.</p><p><br></p><p>The ambience is that of a tavern/hall and is mainly vocal walla and other vocalizations befitting a celebration. I</p><p><br></p><p>This is in Patreon sneak-peek mode until next week, so I've included the mixed track, plus ambience-only, and music-only versions here. (I removed the rhythmic claps from the ambience version as they made no sense without music.). Additionally, I created an 'empty hall' version which leaves a quieter ambience with fire and occasional activity (doors, footsteps etc).&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Finally, I made a looped version of the flute jig that might be nice to add to various things. As always, I create loops in .ogg format as it does the seamless loop thing better, but I've included an .mp3 version as well in case it's needed. &nbsp;I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p><br></p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><br></p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=97569005&amp;m=272796835" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci cm-botCrQ cm-VuJSot cm-zypTtC cm-dupTbP cm-UsNHpA cm-TOsLDU" data-tag="post-attachment-link"><span aria-hidden="true" class="cm-KjCHCa cm-rIvVoM cm-AvhsWt"><svg data-tag="IconDocument" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M13.5 6.374V4.5c0-.628.055-1.003.177-1.222.121-.218.309-.279.573-.279.745 0 2.058.827 3.184 1.896C18.56 5.966 19.5 7.278 19.5 8.25c0 .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 class="cm-zXnyOS"><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-KArsEf cm-LsBaRW"><div class=""><div class="cm-LIiDtl cm-wHoaYV cm-mhTrbr cm-LsBaRW"><div><p>Greetings Patrons,</p><p>Ever since I saw the 1959 classic, Journey to the Center of the Earth with James Mason, I've been a sucker for stories that take characters deep underground. &nbsp;It's as if the plot writes itself. It's dark, it's dangerous and it's not a dungeon. &nbsp;(Of course I love dungeons).</p><p>There's an almost sacred aspect to <em>Whispering Caverns</em>. I imagined it as a resting place (prison?) for lost souls. Perhaps it's your job to free them, or just listen to what they have to say. Maybe the spirits are guardians of an even deeper secret.</p><p>The ambience here is full of hollow cavernous rumbles and eerie spirits whispering. I got to use this excellent piece of new software called Sound Particles which is a 3D audio environment. &nbsp;It allows you to place a virtual microphone among hundreds, or even thousands of particles - where each particle is a piece of audio. The particles can move, rotate, and change in pitch, duration, and distance from the microphone. It's really quite amazing and I've only scratched the surface of what it can do.&nbsp;</p><p>For the music, I went with a kind of 'destroyed' orchestra vibe. There are metallic clangs and some low, breathy vocal textures to go along with the whispers. Through it all there are string melodies that occasionally peak through, only to be subsumed once again by the darkness.</p><p>I wouldn't call it overly grim. It's actually fairly pretty in places.</p><p>As this is in patron-only sneak-peek mode, I've included the mixed version of the track (live on the site next week) as well as music-only and ambience-only versions. &nbsp;Additionally, I've created two 'No Whispers' versions that eliminate most of the spirit voices. Some musical whisper-type elements remain. I hope you find these useful additions.</p><p>Thank you all, as always, for your continuing support.</p><p>Best,</p><p>Tim</p><p><a href="https://tabletopaudio.com">https://tabletopaudio.com</a>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div height="80" opacity="1" class="sc-827a7d51-2 leZcBz"></div></div></div></div><div class="sc-9628564b-0 fOiyPa" data-tag="post-attachments"><span id="track-click"><a href="/file?h=97112740&amp;m=269773787" class="cm-pQxmHn cm-ErDrxA cm-VbVCci .264-.061.452-.28.573-.217.122-.593.177-1.22.177h-1.874c-1.313 0-1.97 0-2.298-.328-.328-.329-.328-.985-.328-2.298M18 10.5h-1.875c-2.062 0-3.094 0-3.61-.516C12 9.47 12 8.438 12 data-tag="comment-field-with-affixes" class="sc-840d7053-1 lcBsSV"><div class="sc-840d7053-9 gdAwnd"><div data-replicated-value="" class="sc-840d7053-4 fIrezf"><textarea aria-invalid="false"
